Re: Invitation to Walkathon â€“ Swachhata Pakhwada 2025
body:
Dear Students,

This is a reminder to join the *Walkathon* tomorrow, *14th September 2025
(Sunday)*, from *7:00 AM â€“ 8:30 AM*. The route will be *Hostel Circle â†’
Main Gate â†’ Hostel Circle*.

   -

   Attendance at the Main Gate closes at *7:45 AM*.
   -

   Strictly no transport allowed during the Walkathon.
   -

   NSS Volunteers will earn *Category 4 Hours*.
   -

   Limited slots (15â€“20) for *â€œMission Clean Walkâ€* with bonus hours â€“
   first come, first serve.

Letâ€™s come together for a cleaner, greener campus. ğŸŒ±

Warm regards,
*Team NSS, IIT Hyderabad*

On Fri, Sep 12, 2025 at 10:16â€¯PM NSS IIT Hyderabad <office.nss@iith.ac.in>
wrote:

> Dear Students,
>
> The National Service Scheme (NSS), IIT Hyderabad warmly invites you to
> participate in a *Walkathon on September 14, 2025*, as part of the *celebration
> of Swachhata Pakhwada*. This initiative highlights our collective
> responsibility to maintain cleanliness and work towards a healthier,
> sustainable future.
>
> *Theme:* *â€œ**Cleanliness for a Sustainable Future: Every Step Counts**â€*
>
> *Event Details:*
> ğŸ“… *Date:* Sunday, 14th September 2025
> â° *Time:* 7:00 AM â€“ 8:30 AM
> ğŸ“ *Route:* Hostel Circle â†’ Main Gate â†’ Hostel Circle
> [image: image.png]
>
> Swachhata Pakhwada emphasizes the importance of cleanliness, hygiene, and
> sustainable practices in our daily lives. Through this Walkathon, we aim to
> raise awareness, inspire action, and reaffirm our commitment to building a
> cleaner and greener environment.
>
> ğŸ”” *Important Notes:*
>
>    -
>
>    NSS Volunteers will be awarded Hours in *Category 4* for participation.
>    -
>
>    Attendance will be taken twice â€“ once near the Main Gate and once at a
>    designated location along the route.
>    -
>
>    Participants must form a proper queue while giving attendance. Any
>    violation may result in zero or negative hours.
>    -
>
>    Attendance at the Main Gate will be closed at *7:45 AM*.
>    -
>
>    *Volunteers are strictly instructed not to use any form of transport
>    (bicycles, e-vehicles, buses etc.) during the Walkathon. Any violation will
>    result in negative hours being awarded.*
>
> ğŸŒ¿ *Special Activity â€“ â€œMission Clean Walkâ€*
> As a new initiative, a small group of *15â€“20 volunteers (on a first-come,
> first-serve basis)* will be provided with garbage bags and gloves to
> collect trash or waste along the walkathon route. This marks our first step
> in combining the spirit of *Swachh Bharat Abhiyan* with the Walkathon.
>
>    -
>
>    Participants of this activity will be awarded *bonus NSS hours* in
>    addition to Walkathon hours.
>    -
>
>    Collected waste will be deposited at a designated collection point
>    after the event.
>    -
>
>    *Clear instructions regarding this special activity will be given at
>    the time of the event.*
>
> Let us come together for a cleaner, greener tomorrow. Your participation
> is more than just a stepâ€”itâ€™s a commitment to change.
>
> *Letâ€™s make every step count! ğŸŒ±*
>
> Warm regards,
> *Team NSS, IIT Hyderabad*
> --
> ---------------------------Regards---------------------------

>

subject: [ICPC] 2025 Asia West Preliminary Round
from: "'Infero IIT Hyderabad' via Students, IIT Hyderabad" <students@iith.ac.in>
body:
Hey everyone,

We are glad to announce that ICPC is back with another set of contests this
year. There are three regionals for this year - *Amritapuri*,* Chennai *and
* Kanpur* and there will be a common preliminary round for these,
tentatively scheduled on *October 11th, 2025.*

Each team of *exactly three contestants* can participate in a *maximum of* *two
regions*. If you have formed a team, please fill this form
<https://docs.google.com/forms/d/1JNFTK4DM8M7zcAE8DLe26dZLqRW-EXdoxDJVo57pK6E/edit>.
If you do not have a team or if you are looking for more teammates, feel
free to ask in the Infero WhatsApp group
<https://chat.whatsapp.com/KA9x2pKPFGXLVkfIEzlaPk> or the Infero Discord
channel <https://discord.com/invite/JP5jxrNNuV>. Please fill the form
latest by* 22 September 2025, 23:59*. Only one member per team needs to
fill this form.

Some important things to keep in mind:

   - After you fill the form, make sure that every member on the team
   creates an account *individually *on the official ICPC website
   <https://icpc.global/> with their institute email address if they have
   never created an account before.
   - *Do NOT register your team on the above website*. We will take care of
   registering your team.
   - Pay the fees for the rounds you are participating in *only after *we
   successfully register your team on the official ICPC website.

Looking forward to a great participation!

Regards,

[image: https://infero.netlify.app/] <https://infero.netlify.app/>

infero.netlify.app



Siddarth & Chaitanya

Infero Heads

subject: Fwd: LLM API access for CS3530 Assignment 1
body:
---------- Forwarded message ---------
From: Vignesh S <cs24mtech12007@iith.ac.in>
Date: Sun, Sep 7, 2025 at 4:56â€¯PM
Subject: LLM API access for CS3530 Assignment 1
To:


Hello,

The access information and instructions for the LLM instance for your
assignment 1 of the course is given below.

*Access information (to be accessed only from the server):*

   - IP address : 192.168.50.142
   - Port: 25000


*Instructions:*

   1. Use HTTP requests to access the API
   2. The LLM instance only supports up to 24 students at a given time.
   Therefore a reservation based mechanism is used. Format is given below.
   3. Reserve the instance by sending a HTTP request to the url *http://{ip
   address}:{port}/reserve* containing a JSON body that has your roll
   number with "rollno" key as shown below.
   4. Sample JSON for reservation:
   { "rollno": "cs24mtech12007" }
   5. Each student gets upto 30 minutes at a time. Also the LLM reservation
   is voided after 5 minutes of idle time.
   6. To generate a quiz, use the url *http://{ip
   address}:{port}/generate_quiz *with the JSON body as shown below.
   7. A sample of generate quiz JSON is as follows:
   {
           "rollno": "cs24mtech12007",
           "messages": [
               {
                   "role": "system",
                   "content": (
                       "You are a trivia generator. Given a genre, output
   exactly 10 multiple-choice "
                       "questions. Each question must have 4 options (A, B,
   C, D) and one correct answer. "
                       "Return ONLY valid JSON in the following format: "
                       '{"questions":[{"q":"...","options":["A) ...","B)
   ...","C) ...","D) ..."],"a":"A"}, ...]}'
                   )
               },
               {
                   "role": "user",
                   "content": f"Generate 10 MCQ trivia questions about
   science."
               }
           ],
           "temperature": 0.0,
           "max_tokens": 1200
   }

To avoid clashes in the server(192.168.50.111), please use the port numbers
as follows for your server to listen to:

   - CS students : Last 5 digits of your roll numbers
   - EE students : Last 5 digits of your roll numbers + 1000
   - ES students : Last 5 digits of your roll numbers + 2000
   - MA students : Last 5 digits of your roll numbers + 3000

Please note that high load on the LLM instance significantly increases the
query processing time. Last minute rush may lead to errors.

subject: Invitation to Walkathon â€“ Swachhata Pakhwada 2025
body:
Dear Students,

The National Service Scheme (NSS), IIT Hyderabad warmly invites you to
participate in a *Walkathon on September 14, 2025*, as part of the *celebration
of Swachhata Pakhwada*. This initiative highlights our collective
responsibility to maintain cleanliness and work towards a healthier,
sustainable future.

*Theme:* *â€œ**Cleanliness for a Sustainable Future: Every Step Counts**â€*

*Event Details:*
ğŸ“… *Date:* Sunday, 14th September 2025
â° *Time:* 7:00 AM â€“ 8:30 AM
ğŸ“ *Route:* Hostel Circle â†’ Main Gate â†’ Hostel Circle
[image: image.png]

Swachhata Pakhwada emphasizes the importance of cleanliness, hygiene, and
sustainable practices in our daily lives. Through this Walkathon, we aim to
raise awareness, inspire action, and reaffirm our commitment to building a
cleaner and greener environment.

ğŸ”” *Important Notes:*

   -

   NSS Volunteers will be awarded Hours in *Category 4* for participation.
   -

   Attendance will be taken twice â€“ once near the Main Gate and once at a
   designated location along the route.
   -

   Participants must form a proper queue while giving attendance. Any
   violation may result in zero or negative hours.
   -

   Attendance at the Main Gate will be closed at *7:45 AM*.
   -

   *Volunteers are strictly instructed not to use any form of transport
   (bicycles, e-vehicles, buses etc.) during the Walkathon. Any violation will
   result in negative hours being awarded.*

ğŸŒ¿ *Special Activity â€“ â€œMission Clean Walkâ€*
As a new initiative, a small group of *15â€“20 volunteers (on a first-come,
first-serve basis)* will be provided with garbage bags and gloves to
collect trash or waste along the walkathon route. This marks our first step
in combining the spirit of *Swachh Bharat Abhiyan* with the Walkathon.

   -

   Participants of this activity will be awarded *bonus NSS hours* in
   addition to Walkathon hours.
   -

   Collected waste will be deposited at a designated collection point after
   the event.
   -

   *Clear instructions regarding this special activity will be given at the
   time of the event.*

Let us come together for a cleaner, greener tomorrow. Your participation is
more than just a stepâ€”itâ€™s a commitment to change.

*Letâ€™s make every step count! ğŸŒ±*

Warm regards,
*Team NSS, IIT Hyderabad*
-- 
---------------------------Regards---------------------------

subject: Re: [Internship] Qualcomm | Interim Engineering Intern - Registration
body:
Dear All,
The *Online Assessment* *(OA)* for *Qualcomm* has been scheduled as part of
the ongoing internship drive. The details are provided below:

   - *Date : Monday, 15th September, 2025.*
   - *Time : 8:00 PM - 9:30 PM*
   - At the time of the assessment, you will be provided with the test link
   corresponding *only* to the profile you have registered for, either SW
   or HW.

*Please note that the students can avail only a single scholarship from
a single stakeholder for a given period of time (i.e. Institute Scholarship
/ NSP/ any government or private sponsored scholarship or any other
financial assistance) and keep us informed while you are applying for
any scholarship.*

*Disclaimer :  IITH is not related to this organisation or the scholarship
schemes offered. You are, therefore, requested to check the authenticity of
the organisation before applying.*

Regards,

subject: Re: [Internship] Macromill | Data Scientist Role
body:
Dear All,

This is to inform you that the *first round *of the internship process with*
Macromill, *conducted on the basis of resumes*,* has been* completed*.

The *students* who have been *shortlisted *for the next rounds have
already *received
a separate mai*l with detailed instructions.

Best regards,
Vishista Reddy
Internship Coordinator
IIT Hyderabad

On Sun, Aug 31, 2025 at 11:15â€¯AM Mandala Vishista Reddy <
ce23btech11029@iith.ac.in> wrote:

> Dear Students,
>
> We are pleased to inform you that *Macromill* will be visiting IIT
> Hyderabad for the Internship 2025â€“26 hiring process for the role of *Data
> Scientist.*â€

subject: Re: Accurate Background Invites You to Participate in AI Hackathon â€“ Sept 19-21, 2025
User Awareness Programme on " Research with Impact with Oxford Journals"
body:
Dear All:

Greetings from INFLIBNET Centre, Gandhinagar!

In collaboration with INFLIBNET Centre Gandhinagar, *Oxford University
Press* is pleased to invite faculty members, researchers, students, and
librarians to our upcoming session titled "*User Awareness Programme on
Research with Impact with Oxford Journals.*"
This session aims to guide participants through the Oxford Academic
platform, helping them discover high-quality research articles and
empowering them to embark on a meaningful and impactful research journey.
We request you to please share this with the faculties, researchers ,
students for registration.

*Session details:*

*Date: Tuesday, 16 September 2025*
*Time: 3:00 - 4:00 PM, IST*
*Online Platform: Microsoft teams*

Kindly click on the link below for registration.
*Registration Link
<https://events.teams.microsoft.com/event/c66f7509-fb00-479c-b536-08f4e8d074fe@91761b62-4c45-43f5-9f0e-be8ad9b551ff>

ONOS Team,
INFLIBNET Centre, Gandhinagar


*With regards,*
*Team KRC*

subject: User Awareness Programme on "One Nation One Subscription (ONOS) with American Mathematical Society , Wednesday, 17 September 2025
body:
Greetings from INFLIBNET Centre, Gandhinagar!

The Government of India has initiated One Nation One Subscription (ONOS), a
Central Sector Ministry of Education (MoE) scheme, to provide access to
13,000+ journals from 30 Publishers from January 2025 onwards. The
INFLIBNET Centre, an IUC of UGC, Gandhinagar, has been entrusted as the
scheme's Implementation Agency.

It is pleased to announce that INFLIBNET Centre is organizing User
Awareness Programme on "One Nation One Subscription (ONOS)" with American
 Mathematical Society on 17th September 2025 from 03:30 to 04:30 p.m.

Please register to join the Webinar https://tinyurl.com/yeakc2fd

For more details, you may contact the ONOS Team at Email:
support@onos.gov.in Phone: 079-23268243/44


*ONOS Team,*
*INFLIBNET Centre, Gandhinagar*

*Regards,*
Team KRC

--

---------- Forwarded message ---------
From: UG Academic Office <acad.ug@iith.ac.in>
Date: Sat, Aug 16, 2025 at 4:02â€¯PM
Subject: Guidelines for Semester-long internship - Reg.
To: B Tech 23 <btech23@iith.ac.in>
Cc: DR Academic <hos.acad@iith.ac.in>, Suresh N <ar.acadug@iith.ac.in>,
Faculty In-Charge Placements <fic.ocs@iith.ac.in>, Placement IIT Hyderabad <
office.placement@iith.ac.in>, Internships IIT Hyderabad <
office.internship@iith.ac.in>, Prasanna R L <prasanna.rl@admin.iith.ac.in>,
Hemalatha S <hemalatha.s@admin.iith.ac.in>, Bhimaraju Hemalatha <
hemalatha.b@admin.iith.ac.in>, Bhanu Modi <bhanu.modi@admin.iith.ac.in>


Dear Students,



Below are the guidelines for pursuing a BTech Semester-long internship at
IITH, in accordance with Senate guidelines:



*No Courses During Internship:* During the semester-long internship, no
courses can be taken.



*No Backlogs*: It is a prerequisite that there are no pending backlogs.



*Industry Internship Letter:* You must obtain a letter from the industry
where you will be interning, confirming that they will allow you to submit
an internship report to the evaluation committee at IITH.



*Tuition Fee:* Tuition fees will be applicable. For information regarding
Hostel Fees and other related expenses, please get in touch with the Hostel
Office.



*Departmental Approval: *Approval from the department, including the
Faculty Advisor (FA) and Department Undergraduate Committee (DUGC), is
mandatory.



*International Internship:* If your internship is outside India, further
approval from the Dean of International Relations (Dean IR) is required.
Upon approval from your department, the Academic office will forward the
request to Dean-IR for approval.



Please keep these guidelines in mind as you plan and proceed with your
BTech Semester-long internship.


*Procedure:* It is mandatory for the students to submit the following form
*(Form-1)* and obtain the "NOC" *(No Objection Certificate)* from the
Academic Section before joining the Internship:



*Semester Long Internship Form-1* - To be submitted by the student to the
Academic Section with the approvals from the Department (FA and DUGC)
before applying to the Internship.



*Semester Long Internship Form-2* - To be shared by the student with the
Industrial Supervisor while attending the Internship or along with the
NOC/Bonafide Certificate.



*Semester Long Internship Form-3* - To be shared by the student with the
Department FA & DUGC/HOD after the completion of the Internship.



You can download the Internship Forms from the following link:


https://www.iith.ac.in/academics/forms/


*Securing a No Objection Certificate (NOC) from the Academic Section is
mandatory for pursuing the Semester Internship.*



To obtain the NOC, please follow the guidelines.

Regards,
S Hemalatha

subject: Maitri Scholarship Awarded to Our First M.Sc. Medical Physics Student
body:
Dear friends,

I am delighted to inform you that Ms. Lakshmi Raja (mp22mscst14002), from
the first batch of the M.Sc. in Medical Physics program, has been awarded
the prestigious Maitri Scholarship. This highly selective scholarship,
provided by the Government of Australia, will support her Ph.D. at The
Australian National University (ANU) in Canberra.

Ms.Raja will be working under the supervision of Prof. Patrick Kluth at the
Research School of Physics, focusing on the detection of blood-based
biomarkers for neurodegenerative diseases using solid-state nanopore
sensing.

This achievement is a great source of pride for the MSc program in the
Medical Physics Program and highlights the success of the program. More
details can be found via the following link:
https://research.anu.edu.au/research-innovation-news/anu-researchers-receive-prestigious-maitri-grants-to-strengthen-australia
.
Let me congratulate Ms.Raja & Faculty coordinators, Medical Physics program
on behalf of all of us and wish them all the best in their future
endeavours.

warm regards,
Murty

subject: Reminder: Attempt TIC 2025 Round 1 - Quiz
body:
Tata Imagination Challenge 2025

Hi Chunduri Navyatha,

Every idea needs a launchpad. For theÂ Tata Imagination Challenge 2025, it begins withÂ Round 1 â€“ the Tata Quiz.Â This is your first step toward bringing your idea to the stage it deserves.

Round 1: Tata Quiz is already live â€“ test your knowledge, showcase your speed, and secure your Participation Certificate.

Quiz Details:

  • Duration: 20 minutes
  • Questions: 20 MCQs (60 seconds each)
  • Scoring: Accuracy + Speed (faster completion gets ranked higher)
  • Marking: No negative marking

Before you attempt, brush up on the world of Tata:

  • Tata Central Archives
  • Tata Tomorrow University
  • Official Tata Portal

How to Attempt:

  1. Visit the [Opportunity Page â€“Â Click Here]
  2. Click on the Verify/Play button underÂ Round 1: Tata Quiz
  3. Follow the instructions to begin

System & Proctoring Requirements:

  • Laptop/Desktop with webcam & mic access (8GB RAM recommended)
  • Stable internet (>10 Mbps)
  • Install the Unstop SmartHire App (Windows/Mac only)
  • Attempt in one uninterrupted sitting
  • Full-screen mode, no tab switching or interruptions
  • Face verification before and during the quiz

Once started, the timer runs continuously. Ensure youâ€™re prepared before beginning.

Register now, attempt the Tata Quiz, and take your idea one step closer to the national stage.

All the best,
Team Tata Imagination Challenge 2025

Here is a checklist for you
Build a rich profile
Add all your experiences, skills, projects, and courses to fully represent yourself!
Update Profile
Understand your job matches
Jobs that match based on your profile will be specifically marked as a "good match" or "strong match".
Track your applications

Set custom alerts
Be the first to know about new job opportunities. Get meaningful alerts for recommended jobs directly into your inbox.

Thank you for joining our Lunar Eclipse Observation Session! It was
wonderful to witness this celestial event together.

The photographs from the session are now available here:
ğŸ‘‰ [Google Drive Link

explore contributions from others.

We apologize for the delay in sharing these and appreciate your patience.
Feel free to view, download, and share the picturesâ€”donâ€™t forget to tag our
club if you post them! ğŸŒ™âœ¨

subject: Fwd: Application Deadline: Live Project in Business Analytics
from: "'Finance and Consulting Club IIT Hyderabad' via Students, IIT Hyderabad" <students@iith.ac.in>
body:
Dear students,
Today is the last day to apply for the Finlatics
Business Analytics program.


*Thanks and Regards,*

*Team FCC,*

*Finance and Consulting Club,*

IIT Hyderabad

fcc@gymkhana.iith.ac.in  |  IIT Hyderabad
<https://maps.google.com/?q=IIT%20Hyderabad>

---------- Forwarded message ---------
From: Arpita Vashishth <arpita.vashishth@finlatics.com>
Date: Thu, 11 Sept 2025, 12:13
Subject: Application Deadline: Live Project in Business Analytics
To: <fcc@gymkhana.iith.ac.in>


Dear IIT Hyderabad Students,


As *today, 11.59pm *is the *deadline to apply* for the *Finlatics Business
Analytics Experience Program*, please note:



1. *N**o prerequisites* or prior domain knowledge are required to
participate in the program as it comes with *p**ersonalised guidance*,
*mentoring *and *live sessions.*

2. If you have any upcoming *assignment,* *examination, *or personal
commitment, you can pick a project start date *after* completing the same
to help the project fit in with your schedule.

3. You will be *allowed a break* during the project tenure for any academic
or personal commitment. You would also be *allowed a Project Extension *of
an additional month in case you cannot complete it in the 2-month duration.



4. You can go over the project details using the copy of the mail below
and apply for the project using the following link:



https://www.finlatics.com/da_applications?src=iithyd



5. The* time commitment *required for the project is around 3-4 hours per
week.


We want to extend our thanks to the team at the* Indian Institute of
Technology, Hyderabad *for their coordination of the application process.

The first mail circulated at the campus is attached below.




On Fri, 5 Sept 2025 at 14:36, Arpita Vashishth <
arpita.vashishth@finlatics.com> wrote:

> Dear IIT Hyderabad Students,
>
>
>
> We're pleased to extend applications for the *Finlatics Business Analytics
> Experience Program*, an online *live project* that helps students learn &
> gain experience in *Data Analytics* and *Forecasting Techniques* at the *SASTRA
> University, Tamil Nadu*.
>
>
>
> This project is being run at leading campuses, including *IIT Bombay, IIT
> Madras, IISc Bangalore,* and *BITS Pilani *among others.
>
>
> *What You'll Learn:*
>
>
> 1. Build interactive dashboards using real sales data.
>
> 2. Gain hands-on experience with* data-driven tools *to understand
> profitability analysis and pricing decisions according to market
> requirements
>
> 3. Explore forecasting techniques, including Linear Forecasting and Exponential
> Smoothing
>
> 4. Learn & engage in *Predictive Modelling *& *Trend Estimation* on
> real-time data to gain actionable insights
>
> 5. Apply *simulations *to profitability and pricing decisions on industry-specific
> case projects.
>
>
>
> *What you'll Get:*
>
>
>
> 1. *Certificate of Work Experience *in* Business Analytics.*
>
> 2. *Letter of Recommendation *based on performance
>
>
>
> *Apply Here (2-3 mins):*
>
> https://www.finlatics.com/da_applications?src=iithy
>
> *N**o prerequisites* or prior domain knowledge are required to be a part
> of the program. All necessary *training *will be imparted to the program.
>
>
> *Project Duration: *2 months, 100% Online.
>
>
> *Time commitment:* 3 - 4 hours per week
>
>
>
> *Project Start*: *Flexible*, based on student choice
>
>
>
> *Project Break & Extension*: Students will be eligible for a *break or
> extension* during the project if needed for any *exams, assignments, *or
> *personal* commitments.
>
>
> If selected, the program has a minimal induction fee of Rs. 1999 / Rs.
> 2999 (on student choice).
>
>
> *Fee Waiver: *A *fee waiver *of *upto 15%* shall be given to all *Indian
> Institute of Technology, Hyderabad *students on the abovementioned
> minimal induction fee.
>
>
> To be eligible for the waiver, kindly apply through the above-mentioned
> link only.
>
>
> Warm regards,
> Team Finlatics
> +91 9136072313
>
> *Know more about us: **https://www.finlatics.com/
> <https://www.finlatics.com/>*
>
> *Visit us on Linkedin: *
> *https://www.linkedin.com/company/fincrux-enabling-insights/*
> <https://www.linkedin.com/company/fincrux-enabling-insights/>
>
> *Mumbai*: 903, Atrium 2, Andheri - Kurla Road
> <https://www.google.com/maps/search/2,+Andheri+-+Kurla+Road?entry=gmail&source=g>,
> Andheri (E), Mumbai 400093
>
> Gurgaon: 424A, Fourth Floor - Tower B3, Spaze I-Tech Park, Sohna Road,
> Sector 49, Gurgaon 122018
> <https://www.google.com/maps/search/Sohna+Road,+Sector+49,+Gurgaon+122018?entry=gmail&source=g>
>
>
>
>

--

subject: ã€ŒOrder Bustersã€Invitation to Upcoming Company Session and Internship Application
body:
Dear student,
I am Nissan from Order Busters.
Thank you very much for attending our recent company session. We truly appreciated the chance to meet you and share more about our work.
I would also like to inform you that on September 24th, we will return to IITH together with other companies to host another company session. We would be delighted if you could join us again for this event.
Additionally, please note that we will start accepting resumes through the internship portal after September 25th. We warmly welcome your application and look forward to reviewing it.
Thank you again for your time and interest, and we hope to see you again soon.

Best regards,
Nissan
Order Busters Inc.

subject: Regarding CA2050 Course Registration
body:
Dear Students,

The course CA2050 (Introduction to visual arts) -1 credit has been floated
for the current July25-Dec25 semester.

The course was initially opened only for 4th-year students and it is now
enabled for *3rd year (2023* *batch*) & *4th year (2022) *students* till
today, 05:00 PM*. The available slots are 30.

Interested students may register within this time. *After the given
deadline, the course will be enabled for 2nd-year students also.*

As informed by the instructor, the classes will be conducted in a workshop
mode *on 13th and 14th, from 10:00 AM to 6:00 PM* (with a lunch break in
between).

*Further requests to add/drop the course after the provided timeline, will
not be accepted..*


Regards,
Prasanna

subject: Re: INTER IIT SELECTIONS - QUIZ
from: "'Literary Society IITH' via Students, IIT Hyderabad" <students@iith.ac.in>
body:
Hello everyone,

Gentle reminder.

Don't forget to bring your own papers and pens!

Regards,
Quiz Club

On Tue, Sep 9, 2025 at 12:48â€¯PM Literary Society IITH <
lit_soc@gymkhana.iith.ac.in> wrote:

> Greetings from the Quiz Club!
>
> We are recruiting members for the Quiz Contingent for the *Inter IIT
> Cultural Meet, *scheduled this December.
> Selections will be done on the basis of a quiz, on *10th September 2025*.
> The quiz will have sections on all the different categories of quizzes
> conducted at Inter IIT:
> 1. General
> 2. MELA - Music, Entertainment, Literature and Arts
> 3. Sports
> 4. India
> 5. TLC - Travel, Lifestyle and Culture
> 6. Sci-Biz-Tech - Science, Business and Technology
> If you feel like your trivia is good in even one of these categories, make
> sure to showcase it in the quiz!
>
> You can participate in the quiz *in teams of up to 3 members.*
>
>
> This is the perfect opportunity to represent IIT Hyderabad on the national
> stage, don't miss it!
>
> *What : Inter IIT Selection Quiz *
> *Date : 10th September 2025 (Wednesday)*
> *Time : 9 PM onwards*
> *Venue : A LH 1*
>
> Please bring your own papers and pens!
>
> Hope to see you all there,
> Regards,
> Quiz Club

subject: Re: Internship Opportunity - Accenture
body:
Dear All,

If your name is not there in the list I have sent earlier, even though
you have registered both on OCS and the company website, there was an
issue with your PAN. If your PAN is not according to the company
guidelines, your name would not have appeared. Since it is an
accenture company guideline, I am extremely sorry but there is nothing
that can be done by OCS or HR.

On Wed, Sep 10, 2025 at 7:27â€¯PM Sai Soham Venkata Mashetty
<es23btech11036@iith.ac.in> wrote:
>
> Dear all,
> Hr has not sent any details regarding the OA yet. I will forward it to
> everyone right after hr sends it
>
> On Wed, Sep 10, 2025 at 2:30â€¯PM Sai Soham Venkata Mashetty
> <es23btech11036@iith.ac.in> wrote:
> >
> > Dear All,
> >
> > Accenture's online assessment will be conducted today. There will be a
> > test window of approximately 12-16 hours, where you can attempt it at
> > any time from anywhere. Further details window timings and links will
> > be shared soon. Please find attached list of registered students
> >
> > On Wed, Aug 27, 2025 at 5:43â€¯PM Sai Soham Venkata Mashetty
> > <es23btech11036@iith.ac.in> wrote:
> > >
> > > Dear Students,
> > >
> > > Accenture has opened registrations for the Summer Internship Program for the 2027 pass-out batch (4-Year UG programs only). Please find below the details:
> > >
> > > Internship Details
> > >
> > > Duration: 2 Months (8 weeks)
> > > Eligibility: Only 4-Year Undergraduate Programs, graduating in 2027
> > >
> > > Registration Process
> > >
> > > Register using the link below and on the OCS website no later than 28th August, 11:55PM.
> > > For Registration: Accenture Registration
> > >
> > > Ensure you use your correct email ID during registration. This is mandatory to receive interview links.
> > >
> > > Only students who register will be considered for the assessment and interview.
> > >
> > > Important: All candidates aspiring to participate in Accentureâ€™s recruitment and selection process will need to have:
> > >
> > >
> > >
> > > A valid Adult PAN card or e-PAN card at the time of their registration with us
> > > Minor PAN card will not be accepted
> > > Adult PAN card with childhood photograph will not be accepted
> > > Adult PAN card without candidateâ€™s legal guardian or father name will not be accepted
> > > Please enter the name as per your PAN Card (in case there is no last name on the PAN Card, please enter your first name twice on the portal)
> > > Please enter the DOB as per your PAN Card
> > > Please try to upload a high-resolution image of your PAN Card
> > > Sharing, a helpful resource that provides a step-by-step guide on how to instantly get an e-PAN card.
> > >
> > >
> > > Resource to apply for instant e-PAN: Video Guide
> > >
> > > Registered candidates will receive the link for assessments and interviews directly from Accenture
> > >
> > > Please go through the attachments carefully before applying.
> > >
> > > Warm regards,
> > > Soham Mashetty
> > > Internship Coordinator
> > > Office of Career Services
> > > 8143508800
> > >
> > >

subject: 51st EPS conference- R S Anandu- Best poster
Bursary Award - APICAM Conference, Melbourne
body:
Dear friends,

I am delighted to inform you that Mr. Sahil Diwan, an IITH-Deakin joint
ID-PhD student (id21resch11020) working under the supervision of Dr.
Viswanath Chinthapenta, Mechanical & Aerospace Engineering, has been
awarded a Bursary Award by Materials Australia for his presentation on
Additive Manufacturing at the 4th Asia-Pacific International Conference on
Additive Manufacturing.

Let me congratulate Sahil and Viswanath on behalf of all of us and wish
them all the best in their future endeavors.

warm regards,
Murty

subject: Dr. Amrita Datta awarded the Elizabeth Adiseshiah Award 2025
body:
Dear friends,

I am delighted to inform you that Dr. Amrita Datta, Department of Liberal
Arts, has been selected for the Elizabeth Adiseshiah Award 2025.
Constituted by the Malcolm and Elizabeth Adiseshiah Trust, the Elizabeth
Adiseshiah Award is presented to a young scholar below the age of 45 for
contributions to Development Studies. It consists of a Citation and a cash
prize of Rs.1 lakh.

Let me congratulate Amrita on behalf of all of us and wish them all the
best in their future endeavours.

warm regards,
Murty

>>
>> On World Suicide Prevention Day, we believe in the power of our shared
>> stories to create hope and connection. With this in mind, the Sunshine Club
>> invites you to a special evening of courage centered around the theme *â€œChanging
>> the Narrativesâ€*: *Heal Out Loud.*
>>
>> This is a safe and supportive community space dedicated to sharing our
>> life experiences  and listening with compassion. It's a time to change the
>> narrative around mental health by giving voice to our experiences and
>> reminding ourselves that no one is alone in their struggles.
>>
>> *Event at a Glance*
>>
>>    -
>>
>>    *What:* *Heal Out Loud* (An Evening of Courageous Narratives)
>>    -
>>
>>    *Date:* Tuesday, September 10th, 2025
>>    -
>>
>>    *Time:* 5:30 PM Onwards
>>    -
>>
>>    *Venue:* C- LH3
>>
>> *Why You Should Join Us*
>>
>>    -
>>
>>    *Share & Change the Narrative:* Your experience has the power to
>>    offer hope, challenge stigma, and show others they aren't alone.
>>    -
>>
>>    *Listen & Support:* Be part of a compassionate community. Simply
>>    listening is a powerful act of solidarity and support.
>>    -
>>
>>    *Build a Brave Space:* Your presence helps create a campus culture
>>    where it's okay not to be okay, and it's brave to talk about it.
>>
>> *Who is this for?*
>>
>> This evening is for everyone. Whether you have an experience to share, a
>> poem to tell, or you simply wish to listen and be part of the community,
>> you are essential.
>>
>> Every voice, every story, and every listener helps change the narrative.
>> Let's come together to create a space of healing and hope.
>> With Regards,
>> Team - Sunshine
>>
>

--

subject: Academic Policies - Feedback Form for Upcoming SUGC and SPGC Meetings & Information
from: "'Secretary, Academic Affairs' via Students, IIT Hyderabad" <students@iith.ac.in>
body:
Dear All,

I hope this email finds you well and thriving in your academic and personal
pursuits.

Many of you would have been facing a lot of problems with Academics due to
any policy or problems with curricula. With a Senate Meeting coming up in
this month, preceded by meetings with the Dean (Academics), SUGC and SPGC,
I would like to collect information/feedback on various academic policies,
confusions and issues faced.

*What will the Academic Affairs Council do?*

Based on the volume of feedback and feasibility of implementation, we shall
forward the *relevant* suggestions to the aforementioned meetings. I will
keep the student in the loop via the SUGC/SPGC Representative of your
batch. The SUGC Representatives of UG 2022, 2023 and 2024 batches are
selected and cc'd in this email; while the SPGC Representatives as well as
the SUGC Representatives of UG 2025 and 5-year Dual Degree batch will be
selected soon.

Please note that we can not guarantee that we will propose every point
given in feedback in the upcoming meetings due to time constraints,
however, this academic year shall have three more Senate meetings and thus
plenty of room to cover all the feedback. It will be dealt on the basis of
importance/impact of the issue and demand by the student community.

*Whom will my feedback be addressed to?*

Some of the feedback will be routed directly to Dean, who will in turn
direct the agenda he deems worthy to the SUGC/SPGC meeting for
recommendation followed by approval in the Senate. The rest will be
directed to the DUGC/DPGC of your respective department based on the nature
of feedback; and you can see the output in the Senate Minutes after the
Senate meeting next month.

*Issues to Avoid Mentioning In The Form:*

*Policies not dealt with by the Senate*

   1. *Grade changes for a particular student:* This is dealt with by the
   instructor.
   2. *Any financial/fee-related Issues:* This is only dealt with by the
   Senate - Section (B), in which Student Representatives are forbidden.
   3. *Any AIIMS Portal Issues:* This is dealt with by the AIIMS Office.
   4. *KRC, OCS, Gymkhana or Other Cell/Club/CR Council Related Issues:* This
   is not dealt with by the Senate.
   5. *Changing Instructor/Grading Policy/Slot Changes of a Specific
   Course:* Dealt with by the instructor only.

Failure to follow the above instructions would lead to non-consideration of
your feedback.

*Issues Encouraged:*

Please have a look at the minutes of previous Senate meetings to have an
understanding of what sort of issues are dealt with by the Senate. The link
for this is present in my signature. I encourage you to fill out
curriculum-related or policy-related issues (basically, anything covered by
the Academic Handbook which requires changes).

*Google Form Link <https://forms.gle/wdusZDz21pRQgBYs9>*
Note: You can also give feedback anonymously if you wish to.

*Keeping You in the Loop:*

If you want to know the position of your proposal in the form, please reply
to this email. As the student group is large, I may not respond
individually to each email on this, I request the respective SUGC/SPGC
Representatives to respond if possible. In case you do not receive a
response within a few days, you may reach out to me in the chat option
given in mail.

*Academic Queries:*

In case of any academic query, you may always reach out to your *Class
Representative* at any moment of time. In case of no response, the next
point of contact would be, in order, the SUGC/SPGC Representative followed
by Academic Affairs Secretary. We will redirect you to the appropriate
authorities, if need be.

*Sai Rishi Kasturi*
Secretary of Academic Affairs

subject: Re: Microbiology-BT2040: Assessment 2
body:
Dear all,
  This is a gentle reminder to please send your presentation slides (in PPT
format) by *6:00 PM today, for* those you are presenting tomorrow.

On Wed, Sep 3, 2025 at 2:51â€¯PM Sandipan Ray <sandipan.ray@bt.iith.ac.in>
wrote:

> Dear All,
> Please find attached the group details for Assessment 2.
>
>    - *You need to present the topic assigned to your group (as a group)*
>    - *You need to prepare a PPT on the given topic (maximum seven slides)*
>    - *The maximum time for presentation is 7 minutes, followed by 2
>    minutes of Q&A*
>    - *15 marks for presentation and 10 marks for Q&A*
>
>
> Group Formation: 2 students (3 in the last one) in each group
> One member from each group should present the PPT, but both members should
> equally contribute to the preparation of the presentation (and approve the
> PPT). The presenting person will be selected during the presentation, so
> both members must be prepared. The Q&A session will involve the
> non-presenting member of the group.
>
> *You must send your PPT to Mr. Saibal Saha at  bt24resch11012@iith.ac.in
> <bt24resch11012@iith.ac.in>* *(TA of this course) at least one day before
> your presentation date, keeping me in cc. You should also keep your group
> partner(s) in cc while sending the PPT. If we do not receive the PPT by 6
> PM on the date before your presentation (such as 9th Sep, 6 PM is the
> deadline for the 1st group), two marks will be deducted.*
>
> *I will not accept any request regarding a change of group or dates. *
>
> Best wishes,
> Sandipan
>
> *----------------------------------------------------------------- *
>
> *Dr. Sandipan Ray, Ph.D., MRSB*
>
>

subject: Re: Internship Opportunity - Accenture
body:
Dear All,

Accenture's online assessment will be conducted today. There will be a
test window of approximately 12-16 hours, where you can attempt it at
any time from anywhere. Further details window timings and links will
be shared soon. Please find attached list of registered students

On Wed, Aug 27, 2025 at 5:43â€¯PM Sai Soham Venkata Mashetty
<es23btech11036@iith.ac.in> wrote:
>
> Dear Students,
>
> Accenture has opened registrations for the Summer Internship Program for the 2027 pass-out batch (4-Year UG programs only). Please find below the details:
>
> Internship Details
>
> Duration: 2 Months (8 weeks)
> Eligibility: Only 4-Year Undergraduate Programs, graduating in 2027
>
> Registration Process
>
> Register using the link below and on the OCS website no later than 28th August, 11:55PM.
> For Registration: Accenture Registration
>
> Ensure you use your correct email ID during registration. This is mandatory to receive interview links.
>
> Only students who register will be considered for the assessment and interview.
>
> Important: All candidates aspiring to participate in Accentureâ€™s recruitment and selection process will need to have:
>
>
>
> A valid Adult PAN card or e-PAN card at the time of their registration with us
> Minor PAN card will not be accepted
> Adult PAN card with childhood photograph will not be accepted
> Adult PAN card without candidateâ€™s legal guardian or father name will not be accepted
> Please enter the name as per your PAN Card (in case there is no last name on the PAN Card, please enter your first name twice on the portal)
> Please enter the DOB as per your PAN Card
> Please try to upload a high-resolution image of your PAN Card
> Sharing, a helpful resource that provides a step-by-step guide on how to instantly get an e-PAN card.
>
>
> Resource to apply for instant e-PAN: Video Guide
>
> Registered candidates will receive the link for assessments and interviews directly from Accenture
>
> Please go through the attachments carefully before applying.
>
> Warm regards,
> Soham Mashetty
> Internship Coordinator
> Office of Career Services
> 8143508800
>
>

Street Asia*.

subject: Re: Heal Out Loud - An Evening of Stories and Support
from: "'Sunshine IIT Hyderabad' via Students, IIT Hyderabad" <students@iith.ac.in>
body:
Dear All,

Please note, the event Heal Out Loud will be on Wednesday(Today), September
10th, 2025. Kindly read it as Wednesday instead of Tuesday mentioned
earlier.
With Regards,
Team - Sunshine


On Wed, 10 Sep 2025 at 09:57, Sunshine IIT Hyderabad <
office.sunshine@campus.iith.ac.in> wrote:

> Dear IITH Community,
>
> On World Suicide Prevention Day, we believe in the power of our shared
> stories to create hope and connection. With this in mind, the Sunshine Club
> invites you to a special evening of courage centered around the theme *â€œChanging
> the Narrativesâ€*: *Heal Out Loud.*
>
> This is a safe and supportive community space dedicated to sharing our
> life experiences  and listening with compassion. It's a time to change the
> narrative around mental health by giving voice to our experiences and
> reminding ourselves that no one is alone in their struggles.
>
> *Event at a Glance*
>
>    -
>
>    *What:* *Heal Out Loud* (An Evening of Courageous Narratives)
>    -
>
>    *Date:* Tuesday, September 10th, 2025
>    -
>
>    *Time:* 5:30 PM Onwards
>    -
>
>    *Venue:* C- LH3
>
> *Why You Should Join Us*
>
>    -
>
>    *Share & Change the Narrative:* Your experience has the power to offer
>    hope, challenge stigma, and show others they aren't alone.
>    -
>
>    *Listen & Support:* Be part of a compassionate community. Simply
>    listening is a powerful act of solidarity and support.
>    -
>
>    *Build a Brave Space:* Your presence helps create a campus culture
>    where it's okay not to be okay, and it's brave to talk about it.
>
> *Who is this for?*
>
> This evening is for everyone. Whether you have an experience to share, a
> poem to tell, or you simply wish to listen and be part of the community,
> you are essential.
>
> Every voice, every story, and every listener helps change the narrative.
> Let's come together to create a space of healing and hope.
> With Regards,
> Team - Sunshine
>

--

subject: Re: Join The Sunshine Stride: A Morning Walk for Hope
from: "'Sunshine IIT Hyderabad' via Students, IIT Hyderabad" <students@iith.ac.in>
body:
Hi Everybody,
    This is a gentle reminder about Sunshine's morning walk event called
Sunshine Strides happening today.

We will start the walk at 6am from the Hostel Circle.

For more details you may refer to the attached poster and route map.

We look forward to seeing you there

With Regards,
Team - Sunshine

On Tue, 9 Sept 2025, 10:11 Sunshine IIT Hyderabad, <
office.sunshine@campus.iith.ac.in> wrote:

> Dear IITH Community,
>
> As part of Suicide Prevention Week, Sunshine, the Counselling cell of IITH
> invites you to our morning walk event, *The Sunshine Stride*. This is
> more than just a walk; it's a chance to come together as a community,
> promote well-being, and show support for mental health awareness.
>
> *Why Join the Stride?*
>
> *Start with Hope*: Begin the day with a positive, collective action.
>
> *Stand in Solidarity*: Show your support for creating a compassionate
> campus.
>
> *Connect with the Community*: Walk alongside friends, colleagues, and
> fellow community members.
>
> *Boost Your Well-Being*: Enjoy a refreshing start to your day with some
> gentle morning exercise.
>
> *Event at a Glance*
>
> *Event:* Sunshine Strides
>
> *Date: *Wednesday, September 10th
>
> *Time:* 6:00 AM
>
> *Starting Point*: Hostel Circle
>
> *Route*: From Hostel Circle to the IITH Main Gate.  The route map is
> attached for your reference
>
> This walk is open to all students, faculty, and staff. To help us plan, we
> encourage you to register in advance here: To register, please Click here
> <https://docs.google.com/forms/d/e/1FAIpQLSdU3oGD0ugyKmAd0RVHRZMEeNdln7eKp1EwhdGNXJoPCwJp8w/viewform>
> We will also have on-the-spot registrations at the starting point for
> those who decide to join in the morning.
>
> Letâ€™s take steps together towards hope. We look forward to seeing you
> there.
>
> With Regards,
> Team - Sunshine
>

--

subject: Data Analyst: 2025 Winter Internship AGC
body:
Dear Students,

Please find below some additional clarifications (beyond the information
already shared) in response to common queries received:

   1.

   *Stipend*: This is a paid internship offering *â‚¹40,000 per month*, with
   a *Pre-Placement Offer (PPO)* opportunity based on performance.
   2.

   *Travel Support*: Travel expenses for the 1-week *immersion program in
   Gurugram* will be covered by the company with housing support.
   3.

   *Tentative Duration*: ~*8th Dec 2025 to *~*14th Feb 2026*.
   4.

   *Work Mode & Schedule*: The internship is *remote*. During the vacation
   period, students are expected to work *full-time*. Once the academic
   session begins, students may *mutually coordinate *with the company to
   adjust working hours so that academic commitments are not affected.
   5.

   *Eligibility*: Open to students from *all branches*, preferably those
   with relevant *skills or interest* in: Python, Machine Learning,
   Analytics, Deep Learning, Artificial Intelligence

*Note*: As our institute does not have an official Winter Internship
policy, students *must obtain* *prior approvals from DUGC/ DPGC and HoD* before
applying. The Office of Career Services (OCS) is only facilitating this
opportunity with our students and does not handle approvals.
*~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~*

*PLACEMENT CELL*
*Office of Career Services (OCS)*

*# 313, 3rd Floor, Academic Block "B"*

*Phone No. : 2301 6810*
*Indian Institute of Technology Hyderabad*
*Kandi, Sangareddy, Telangana 502 284*

--

body:
Greetings from IITH-KRC/Library !!!

Dear All,

We are pleased to inform you about the revised timings of the Knowledge
Resource Centre (KRC)/Library, as outlined below, w.e.f.* September 15,
2025* for the IITH community.

Please note the following revised library timings and their services as
below:

Name of the Service/Facility

  Timings

Monday to Friday

Ground Floor - Reading Area (after 1.50 am)

24x5 (except weekend/holidays)*

All Reading Areas (GF, FF, SF & SF)**

9:00 AM - 01:50 AM

Circulation Section (Issue and Return of Books)

9:00 AM - 20:30 PM

Photocopy / Printing Service (GF)

9:00 AM - 20:30 PM

Group Discussion Rooms (TF) access

9:00 AM - 01:00 AM

Reference Section (SF)

9:00 AM - 01:50 AM

Cyber Library (FF) - Learning Commons Lab-1

9:00 AM - 11:00 PM

Cyber Library (FF) - Research Commons Lab-2

9:00 AM - 20:30 PM

AV Room / Seminar Room / VC Room

As per bookings (up to 20:30 PM only)

*Saturday, Sunday and Institute Holidays

All Reading Areas

9:00 AM - 2:00 AM (17 hours)

**GF-Ground Floor, FF-First Floor; SF-Second Floor; TF-Third Floor

Note: Please be aware that any misuse of these extended facilities may
result in restricted access to the Library. We therefore urge all users to
follow and abide by the KRC/LIBRARY RULES
<https://drive.google.com/file/d/1sLQg0DrkltdS76lNmfEmbQUam1ATyLZt/view?usp=sharing>
carefully.

We encourage you to fully utilise the extended hours and enhanced library
services to support your teaching, learning, and research activities. For
detailed information about the KRC, its facilities, and services, please
refer to KNOW YOUR KRC
<https://drive.google.com/file/d/1Rx9AIwjJ7WIchXVV1XgiD7vz705FdbP1/view?usp=sharing>
.

This issues are with the approval of the competent authority.

Happy Reading !!!

technical and communication skills, and will help students prepare more
effectively for future opportunities.

body:
Dear Students,

The Pre-Placement Talk (PPT) for the Visa Software Engineering Intern
(Summer Internship) has been rescheduled to 11th September 2025.

Please note that the deadline for registration remains 10th September 2025.
Attendance is mandatory for all eligible and interested students.

ğŸ”¹ Note: For this internship, Visa is considering only Integrated M.Tech
programs from eligible branches, and not the 2-year M.Tech courses.

Best Regards,
Aditya Kumar Barwaye
Placement Coordinator
OCS, IIT Hyderabad

subject: Data Analyst: 2025 Winter Internship AGC
body:
Dear Students,

We are pleased to share an exciting *Winter Internship* opportunity with *AGC
Asia Pacific*, a company that recently participated in *Japan Career Day
2025*.

*About the Internship:*

   -

   *Role:* Data Analyst Intern
   -

   *Number of positions:* 10
   -

   *Mentorship:*
   -

      6 interns will be mentored by experienced Indian professionals
      -

      4 interns will receive guidance from distinguished Japanese experts
      -

   *Exposure:*
   -

      Remote internship with a *one-week immersive visit* to the Gurugram
      office
      -

      Direct interaction with the Japanese team
      -

   *Duration:* 2 months of hands-on project work and professional mentorship
   -

   *Eligibility:*
   -

      1st-year Masterâ€™s students (graduating in 2027)
      -

      2nd-year Masterâ€™s RA students (graduating in Dec 2026)
      -

      3rd-year Bachelorâ€™s students (graduating in 2027)
      -

   *Branch restrictions:* None

*Application Process:*
Interested students are requested to fill out the *Google Form*
<https://forms.gle/tppDsHApT22egAHm6> to apply. It is mandatory to have
DUGC/DPGC as well as HoD approval before applying.

*Deadline to Apply:* September 12, *(12 noon)*

Feel free to reach at +91 9421674592 or gs24mtech11014@iith.ac.in (Sumedh
Ayachit) for any queries.

Thanks & regards,

Sumedh Ayachit

-- 


*~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~*

*PLACEMENT CELL*
*Office of Career Services (OCS)*

*# 313, 3rd Floor, Academic Block "B"*

*Phone No. : 2301 6810*
*Indian Institute of Technology Hyderabad*
*Kandi, Sangareddy, Telangana 502 284*

--

subject: INTER IIT SELECTIONS - QUIZ
from: "'Literary Society IITH' via Students, IIT Hyderabad" <students@iith.ac.in>
body:
Greetings from the Quiz Club!

We are recruiting members for the Quiz Contingent for the *Inter IIT
Cultural Meet, *scheduled this December.
Selections will be done on the basis of a quiz, on *10th September 2025*.
The quiz will have sections on all the different categories of quizzes
conducted at Inter IIT:
1. General
2. MELA - Music, Entertainment, Literature and Arts
3. Sports
4. India
5. TLC - Travel, Lifestyle and Culture
6. Sci-Biz-Tech - Science, Business and Technology
If you feel like your trivia is good in even one of these categories, make
sure to showcase it in the quiz!

You can participate in the quiz *in teams of up to 3 members.*


This is the perfect opportunity to represent IIT Hyderabad on the national
stage, don't miss it!

*What : Inter IIT Selection Quiz *
*Date : 10th September 2025 (Wednesday)*
*Time : 9 PM onwards*
*Venue : A LH 1*

Please bring your own papers and pens!

Hope to see you all there,
Regards,
Quiz Club

--

subject: Ready to take off? Start with the Tata Quiz â€“ Round 1
body:
Tata Imagination Challenge 2025

Hi Chunduri Navyatha,

Every idea needs a launchpad. For the Tata Imagination Challenge 2025, it begins with Round 1 â€“ the Tata Quiz. This is your first step toward bringing your idea to the stage it deserves.

Round 1: Tata Quiz is live â€“ test your knowledge, showcase your speed, and secure your Participation Certificate.

Quiz Details:

  • Duration: 20 minutes
  • Questions: 20 MCQs (60 seconds each)
  • Scoring: Accuracy + Speed (faster completion gets ranked higher)
  • Marking: No negative marking

Before you attempt, brush up on the world of Tata:

  • Tata Central Archives
  • Tata Tomorrow University
  • Official Tata Portal

How to Attempt:

  1. Visit the [Opportunity Page â€“ Click Here]
  2. Click on the Verify/Play button under Round 1: Tata Quiz
  3. Follow the instructions to begin

System & Proctoring Requirements:

  • Laptop/Desktop with webcam & mic access (8GB RAM recommended)
  • Stable internet (>10 Mbps)
  • Install the Unstop SmartHire App (Windows/Mac only)
  • Attempt in one uninterrupted sitting
  • Full-screen mode, no tab switching or interruptions
  • Face verification before and during the quiz

Once started, the timer runs continuously. Ensure youâ€™re prepared before beginning.

Register now, attempt the Tata Quiz, and take your idea one step closer to the national stage.

All the best,
Team Tata Imagination Challenge 2025

subject: Fwd: Live Project in Business Analytics
from: "'Finance and Consulting Club IIT Hyderabad' via Students, IIT Hyderabad" <students@iith.ac.in>
body:
Dear Community,
Please Find the details regarding the application for the Live project
opportunity by Finlatics in Business Analytics.

Best regards,
Team FCC

*Thanks and Regards,*

*Team FCC,*

*Finance and Consulting Club,*

IIT Hyderabad

fcc@gymkhana.iith.ac.in  |  IIT Hyderabad
<https://maps.google.com/?q=IIT%20Hyderabad>

---------- Forwarded message ---------
From: Arpita Vashishth <arpita.vashishth@finlatics.com>
Date: Fri, 5 Sept 2025, 14:36
Subject: Live Project in Business Analytics
To: <fcc@gymkhana.iith.ac.in>


Dear IIT Hyderabad Students,



We're pleased to extend applications for the *Finlatics Business Analytics
Experience Program*, an online *live project* that helps students learn &
gain experience in *Data Analytics* and *Forecasting Techniques* at the *SASTRA
University, Tamil Nadu*.



This project is being run at leading campuses, including *IIT Bombay, IIT
Madras, IISc Bangalore,* and *BITS Pilani *among others.


*What You'll Learn:*


1. Build interactive dashboards using real sales data.

2. Gain hands-on experience with* data-driven tools *to understand
profitability analysis and pricing decisions according to market
requirements

3. Explore forecasting techniques, including Linear Forecasting and Exponential
Smoothing

4. Learn & engage in *Predictive Modelling *& *Trend Estimation* on
real-time data to gain actionable insights

5. Apply *simulations *to profitability and pricing decisions on
industry-specific
case projects.



*What you'll Get:*



1. *Certificate of Work Experience *in* Business Analytics.*

2. *Letter of Recommendation *based on performance



*Apply Here (2-3 mins):*

https://www.finlatics.com/da_applications?src=iithy

*N**o prerequisites* or prior domain knowledge are required to be a part of
the program. All necessary *training *will be imparted to the program.


*Project Duration: *2 months, 100% Online.


*Time commitment:* 3 - 4 hours per week



*Project Start*: *Flexible*, based on student choice



*Project Break & Extension*: Students will be eligible for a *break or
extension* during the project if needed for any *exams, assignments, *or
*personal* commitments.


If selected, the program has a minimal induction fee of Rs. 1999 / Rs. 2999
(on student choice).


*Fee Waiver: *A *fee waiver *of *upto 15%* shall be given to all *Indian
Institute of Technology, Hyderabad *students on the abovementioned minimal
induction fee.


To be eligible for the waiver, kindly apply through the above-mentioned
link only.


Warm regards,
Team Finlatics
+91 9136072313

*Know more about us: **https://www.finlatics.com/
<https://www.finlatics.com/>*

*Visit us on Linkedin: *
*https://www.linkedin.com/company/fincrux-enabling-insights/*
<https://www.linkedin.com/company/fincrux-enabling-insights/>

*Mumbai*: 903, Atrium 2, Andheri - Kurla Road
<https://www.google.com/maps/search/2,+Andheri+-+Kurla+Road?entry=gmail&source=g>,
Andheri (E), Mumbai 400093

Gurgaon: 424A, Fourth Floor - Tower B3, Spaze I-Tech Park, Sohna Road,
Sector 49, Gurgaon 122018
<https://www.google.com/maps/search/Sohna+Road,+Sector+49,+Gurgaon+122018?entry=gmail&source=g>

--

Re: Shiksha Sankalp Excellence Award for undergraduate Female marginalized and specially-abled (girl students)
body:
Dear Students,

Reference the trailing mail, this is a gentle reminder to apply for this
excellence award.

Eligibility: The award is for the girl students admitted into the first
semester of their undergraduate program and the primary objective is to
provide financial support to the undergraduate female marginalized students
(Economically Weaker Sections) as well as specially-abled (PwD) (girl
students) at IIT Hyderabad by covering their Hostel and Mess Fee.

If you meet the eligibility criteria and are interested, please submit your
application before the deadline.

Click here for detailed information and to apply:
https://forms.gle/JRKzcdor2Te9nVhD8

Do reach out to office.ar@iith.ac.in with a copy to Dean.acr@iith.ac.in for
any queries.

Thanks and regards
Team ACR

On Wed, Sep 3, 2025 at 4:22â€¯PM Alumni Relations Office <office.ar@iith.ac.in>
wrote:

> Dear Students,
>
> The office of Alumni and Corporate Relations is pleased to roll out the
> "Shiksha Sankalp Excellence Award". The primary objective is to provide
> sustainable financial support to *undergraduate female marginalized
> students (Economically Weaker Sections) as well as specially-abled (PwD) **(girl
> students)* at IIT Hyderabad.
>
> This excellence award specifically focuses to assist students by covering
> their Hostel and Mess Fee. Additionally, the award is for the girl students
> admitted into the *first semester of their undergraduate program*.
>
> Detailed information is provided in the below form, kindly go through the
> form and submit your responses if you are interested and eligible.
>
> Click to Apply: https://forms.gle/JRKzcdor2Te9nVhD8
>
> Do reach out to office.ar@iith.ac.in with a copy to Dean.acr@iith.ac.in
> for any queries.
>
> Thanks and regards
> Team ACR
>


-- 
Thanks & Regards,

--

subject: Admission to 'Certificate Course in Sanskrit Language' and 'Diploma Course in Sanskrit Language'
body:
Dear all,

Please see the following email on the Sanskrit language courses. A
wonderful opportunity!

The instructor and Faculty in charge Dr. Ramakrishna U are CC'd.

Thanks.
----------------------
Namaste to All,

Under the guidance of Central Sanskrit University, New Delhi, IIT Hyderabad
presents a golden opportunity to learn Sanskrit, the mother of all
traditional languages. The Center for Sanskrit Learning (CSL) at IIT
Hyderabad is hosting another round of courses, including a basic Sanskrit
course on campus. These courses are open to everyoneâ€”students, faculty,
staff, their families, and even individuals outside of IITH. Anyone who has
passed the 10th standard is eligible to enroll.

This course is designed to be convenient, making it easy to speak, read,
and write Sanskrit. Additionally, participants will learn to recite verses,
sing in Sanskrit, and engage with various moral stories in the language.
The CSL is offering two specific courses: a 'Certificate Course in Sanskrit
Language' for beginners, and a 'Diploma in Sanskrit Language' for those who
have completed the first course. Don't miss this golden opportunity to
immerse yourself in the rich tradition of Sanskrit.

Two courses are being offered: Certificate course and Diploma course.
Diploma course is only for learners who have passed the certificate course.

This Certificate Course at IITH is recommended for beginners and will focus
on a graded learning method, with flexibility where the students can decide
their pace and joining.

There are absolutely no prerequisites for joining this course. More details
are available in the attached poster.

Registration Link: https://csucsl.samarth.edu.in/
Last date of registration: 20 Sept.

Please contact the instructor of this course for more questions.

Namaste,
Course Instructor: Shri. Biswarup Bej <biswarupbej@hst.iith.ac.in>
Phone: +91 9749084988

Instructor, Centre for Sanskrit Learning of CSU
Department of HST
IIT Hyderabad, Block-A-717 F
----------------------


Regards,

Kousik Sarathy Sridharan, PhD
*Associate Professor & Head, *
*Dept. of Heritage Sci. & Tech.*
*IIT Hyderabad*

Further to my earlier email about abstract submissions, I would like to
clarify the dates for IIM ATM 2025:

*The 79th Annual Technical Meeting of the Indian Institute of Metals
(IIM-ATM 2025) will be held at IIT Hyderabad from 3rd to 6th December 2025.*

Please continue submitting your *abstracts by 20th September 2025* and mark
your calendars to ensure your availability during the conference.

Looking forward to strong participation from all departments!

*IIM ATM is Indiaâ€™s flagship national and international conference covering
the entire spectrum of Materials Science and Engineering* â€” *from critical
minerals and extractive metallurgy to advanced materials (alloys, ceramics,
polymers, composites), advances in manufacturing technologies, physical and
mechanical metallurgy, energy materials, functional materials, ICME
(Integrated Computational Materials Engineering) and AI/ML applications in
materials research, computational modeling, and Industry 4.0 applications
in materials and manufacturing.*

*This yearâ€™s event is of special significance, as it is being hosted at IIT
Hyderabad, and our Director is serving as the President of IIM.* This is a
moment of pride for our institution and an excellent opportunity to
showcase our research and innovation on a national and international stage.

We warmly invite participation from all related departments â€” Materials
Science and Metallurgical Engineering, Mechanical and Aerospace
Engineering, Chemical Engineering, Civil Engineering, Electrical
Engineering, AI, Physics, Chemistry, and all allied disciplines â€” to submit
abstracts and represent our institution strongly at this prestigious
gathering.

*Please submit your abstracts well before the deadline of 20th September to
avoid last-minute issues.*
Submission guidelines and details are available at: https://iimatm.in/

Let us make our presence felt and ensure that our institution is
prominently represented at this landmark edition of IIM ATM.

Thanks and Regards,

Saswata

subject: Re: Implementation of 24Ã—7 Library Access as Promised
body:
Dear friends,
I am committed to keeping the library open 24x7. I told this to our
Librarian almost 3 months back. However, we needed additional staff for
this and I approved additional staff. The library has now acquired the
additional staff. *I want the library to start functioning 24x7 from
September 15th.* However, only certain sections of the library will be open
after 12 midnight for easy monitoring. I hope the students will use it for
the purpose for which the Library is meant for. Anyone who misuses this
opportunity provided will not have access to the library. To the best of my
knowledge, there are very few academic institutes in India (or possibly
none) where the library is open 24x7 (except for the exams time) and we are
making this exception for our institute to provide opportunity to those who
want to make use of this opportunity for study purposes) .

warm regards,
Murty
************************************************
à¤ªà¥à¤°à¥‹. à¤¬à¥€.à¤à¤¸. à¤®à¥‚à¤°à¥à¤¤à¤¿/ Prof. B.S. Murty

à¤¨à¤¿à¤¦à¥‡à¤¶à¤•/ Director

à¤­à¤¾à¤°à¤¤à¥€à¤¯ à¤ªà¥à¤°à¥Œà¤¦à¥à¤¯à¥‹à¤—à¤¿à¤•à¥€ à¤¸à¤‚à¤¸à¥à¤¥à¤¾à¤¨ à¤¹à¥ˆà¤¦à¤°à¤¾à¤¬à¤¾à¤¦, à¤•à¤‚à¤¦à¥€, à¤¸à¤‚à¤—à¤¾à¤°à¥‡à¤¡à¥à¤¡à¥€-502284
Indian Institute of Technology Hyderabad, Kandi, Sangareddy-502284

Email: bsm@iith.ac.in; director@iith.ac.in
Phone: +91-40-2301 6002; +91-83310 36001
************************************************


On Sun, 7 Sept 2025 at 17:37, Nukavarapu Yaswanth Sai <
ch25mtech11010@iith.ac.in> wrote:

> Respected sir,
>
> During orientation, you assured us that the library would soon be made
> open 24Ã—7. It has now been more than a month, and the timings remain
> restricted to 9:00 AM â€“ 2:00 AM. This is not in line with the commitment
> made to students.
>
> The current schedule forces students towards late-night study hours, while
> completely neglecting those who prefer early mornings, which research shows
> are actually more effective for learning (Schmidt et al., 2007, *Chronobiology
> International*).
>
> If single rooms were provided, students could have managed by studying in
> their rooms at any hour. But with double sharing, switching on the lights
> early in the morning directly disturbs roommates, making it impossible to
> study in the hostel.
>
> In this situation, the library is the only proper study space. Restricting
> its availability in the mornings leaves us with no practical option. The
> promise of 24Ã—7 access was not just desirable; it was necessary, especially
> given the living conditions provided.
>
> We therefore strongly request that the administration immediately
> implement 24Ã—7 access to the library, as was assured to us during
> orientation.
>
> This is about fairness, honouring commitments, and ensuring that all
> students, regardless of their study schedules, have equal opportunity to
> use the library.
>
> I sincerely hope you will keep your word and ensure that this promise is
> fulfilled without further delay.
>
> Sincerely,
> Nukavarapu Yaswanth Sai
> CH25MTECH11010
>
> Disclaimer:- This footer text is to convey that this email is sent by one
> of the users of IITH. So, do not mark it as SPAM.
>

On Sat, 6 Sep, 2025, 5:02 pm Cultural Secretary, <
cult_secy@gymkhana.iith.ac.in> wrote:

> Hey Everyone,
>
> The selections for *Fashion at Inter-IIT Culturals 8.0* are now open!
>
> IIT Hyderabad will be participating in this yearâ€™s edition hosted at *IIT
> Kanpur*, and we are looking for passionate participants to represent us.
>
> There are *two exciting opportunities* this time:

subject: Greetings and Call for Ideas for Academic Transformation@IITH
body:
Dear Students,

Greetings from the Office of Academics Affairs at IIT Hyderabad and
congratulations to all the students community for IITH achieving all time
highest 7th Rank at NIRF under the guidance and leadership of our Director.

On behalf of academic office, we thank all the on roll 5751 (UG:PG=41:59)
and graduated 8589 (UG:PG=38:62) students for their hard work in publishing
quality research articles and participating in prestigious and innovative
competitions and hackathons. Thanks to different students clubs which have
played crucial role in keeping the students activities and academic
creativity go in parallel.

As you know, any great Institutions like world's number one MIT and India's
number one IIT Madras are able to maintain the highest standing among all
of the Institution primarily due to the creative and innovative academic
activities, quality research publications (Q-factor), and development of
technical solutions for the nation and the world at large.

While many of you are doing hard work towards achieving some of the above
goals to some extent, I am sure many of you, like me, willing to see IITH
also in the league of those Institution in the years to come! It is a proud
moment of all of us what we have achieved in shorter span of 17 Yrs but
need lots of discipline and measured direction to achieve the excellence in
academics like other great Institutions. Though, we have  had prestigious
Universities like Nalanda, we are on the path of making our Indian
Institutions great again. While doing so I would like to remind you that
even University like Allahabad University used to be called Harvard of
East, the quality of the Institution started degrading due to lack of
discipline by the students and others at the helm!

As we are on the path of creating history by promoting innovative and
creative teaching methodology, interdisciplinary programs, Industry based
research problems, hands-on activities based on NEP, hackathons, inviting
companies, national and multinational, to open their offices in Technology
Research Park and to give Industrial lectures, Joining hands with foreign
and Indian Institutions to train the manpower of current and future
technologies for taking the Indian Economy from 4th to 3rd in the world.

While we perform our duties, we expect your active involvement in the
pursuit of achieving the goals of the Institute as well as the Nation in
serving the humanity at its best! While we go upward to the peak of the
mountain, any deviation from the goal will make us fall back. Therefore, I
encourage you to take the leadership role with hard work, perseverance and
most important disciplined approach in achieving your goal of excellence in
academics and other activities.

To achieve this goal of academic excellence we invite you to share with us
ideas on how to transform academics at IIT Hyderabad for all of us!

I will end of message with an old saying which describes the quality of a
best student:

*à¤¶à¥à¤²à¥‹à¤• *(Shloka): *à¤•à¤¾à¤• à¤šà¥‡à¤·à¥à¤Ÿà¤¾, à¤¬à¤•à¥‹ à¤§à¥à¤¯à¤¾à¤¨à¤‚, à¤¶à¥à¤µà¤¾à¤¨ à¤¨à¤¿à¤¦à¥à¤°à¤¾ à¤¤à¤¥à¥ˆà¤µ à¤š à¥¤ à¤…à¤²à¥à¤ªà¤¾à¤¹à¤¾à¤°à¥€,
à¤—à¥ƒà¤¹à¤¤à¥à¤¯à¤¾à¤—à¥€, à¤µà¤¿à¤¦à¥à¤¯à¤¾à¤°à¥à¤¥à¥€ à¤ªà¤‚à¤š à¤²à¤•à¥à¤·à¤£à¤‚ à¥¥ *

*English Version*: *Kaak cheshta, bako dhyanam, shwan nidra tathaiva cha.
Alpahari, grihtyaagi, vidyarthi panch lakshanam*

*English Meaning*: Effort of a crow, concentration of a crane (or heron),
light sleep like a dog, eating less, and less involvement in home
mattersâ€”these are the five characteristics of a student.

*Further Description*:

Kak chesta: The effort or tireless endeavor of a crow.
Bako dhyanam: The intense, focused concentration of a crane.
Shwan nidra: The light, alert sleep of a dog, which wakes up at the
slightest sound.
Alpahari: One who eats only as much as is needed.
Grihtyagi: One who renounces the comforts and attachments of home

Thank you very much and looking forward to your active involvement in
academic activities to make the learning fun and beneficial to all of you
for which you are the part of the IITH community.

Please do not hesitate to write to me any ideas that you have which can be
implemented to achieve the best environment for teaching and learning.

Best wishes,

Prof. Ashok Kumar Pandey
Dean (Acad), IIT Hyderabad
Office: 408 Admin Block

--

subject: LLM API access for CS3530 Assignment 1
body:
Hello,

The access information and instructions for the LLM instance for your
assignment 1 of the course is given below.

*Access information (to be accessed only from the server):*

   - IP address : 192.168.50.142
   - Port: 25000


*Instructions:*

   1. Use HTTP requests to access the API
   2. The LLM instance only supports up to 24 students at a given time.
   Therefore a reservation based mechanism is used. Format is given below.
   3. Reserve the instance by sending a HTTP request to the url *http://{ip
   address}:{port}/reserve* containing a JSON body that has your roll
   number with "rollno" key as shown below.
   4. Sample JSON for reservation:
   { "rollno": "cs24mtech12007" }
   5. Each student gets upto 30 minutes at a time. Also the LLM reservation
   is voided after 5 minutes of idle time.
   6. To generate a quiz, use the url *http://{ip
   address}:{port}/generate_quiz *with the JSON body as shown below.
   7. A sample of generate quiz JSON is as follows:
   {
           "rollno": "cs24mtech12007",
           "messages": [
               {
                   "role": "system",
                   "content": (
                       "You are a trivia generator. Given a genre, output
   exactly 10 multiple-choice "
                       "questions. Each question must have 4 options (A, B,
   C, D) and one correct answer. "
                       "Return ONLY valid JSON in the following format: "
                       '{"questions":[{"q":"...","options":["A) ...","B)
   ...","C) ...","D) ..."],"a":"A"}, ...]}'
                   )
               },
               {
                   "role": "user",
                   "content": f"Generate 10 MCQ trivia questions about
   science."
               }
           ],
           "temperature": 0.0,
           "max_tokens": 1200
   }

To avoid clashes in the server(192.168.50.111), please use the port numbers
as follows for your server to listen to:

   - CS students : Last 5 digits of your roll numbers
   - EE students : Last 5 digits of your roll numbers + 1000
   - ES students : Last 5 digits of your roll numbers + 2000
   - MA students : Last 5 digits of your roll numbers + 3000

Please note that high load on the LLM instance significantly increases the
query processing time. Last minute rush may lead to errors.

--

subject: Re: [Internship] Media.net | Senior Product Analyst Intern â€“ Registration
body:
Dear All,
Hope you are doing well.

Please find below a few important instructions for the Online Assessment
scheduled tomorrow:

   1.

   Ensure you have signed up on *InterviewBit <www.interviewbit.com>* using
   your institute email ID.
   2.

   Keep your *resume ready* to upload on the portal before the test.
   (Please upload the same version that was submitted on the OCS portal.)
   3.

   Notebooks are *not allowed*. You may bring only a few sheets of paper.
   Bags must be placed in front of the classroom, with mobile phones kept
   inside on silent mode.
   4.

   Keep your *IIT Hyderabad ID card handy*, placed on the table facing
   upwards.
   5.

     Students who already have their internships confirmed are *not allowed
   to appear for the OA*.

We request you to kindly follow the above instructions carefully to ensure
a smooth and fair assessment process.

Warm Regards,

*Sarvesh Goyal*
Internship Coordinator, OCS
Indian Institute of Technology Hyderabad

subject: Re: Meet ServiceNow 2025 | Mandatory Registration for September 8 Sessions
body:
Dear Students,

This is the *final reminder* for *Meet ServiceNow 2025*, scheduled on
*September
8, 2025*.

Students who are interested and have not registered yet are requested
to *register
before 5:00 PM today* using the links below:

   1.

   *Orientation & Interview Readiness* (mandatory for participants)
   ğŸ”— Register for Meet ServiceNow 2025 Orientation | IIT Hyderabad
   <https://talent.servicenow.com/flows/meet-servicenow-2025-orientation-session-iit-hyderabad-edushzdwa>
   2.

   *Networking Session (exclusive, limited seats)*
   ğŸ”— Register for Meet ServiceNow 2025 Networking Session
   <https://forms.gle/ECVyeGVoVszeWNFf8>

*Registration Deadline:* *Today, 5:00 PM*
------------------------------
General Guidelines for September 8 Sessions:

   -

   *Attendance will be taken* for all sessions.
   -

   Since the Orientation is scheduled to begin at *10:30 AM*, students are
   requested to *assemble at the venue at least 10 minutes earlier (by
   10:20 AM)* to avoid delays.
   -

   After the Orientation session, there will be a *10-minute break*,
   followed by the *Interview Readiness* session in the same venue.
   -

   Post the morning sessions, there will be a *lunch break*. The *Networking
   session* will begin *sharp at 2:00 PM*.
   -

   A *separate email* will be sent to the students selected for the
   Networking session.

*Venue for Orientation & Interview Readiness:* A-Block Auditorium
