subject: Re: Offline Essay Writing & Drawing Competition â€“ 7th September 2025.
body:
Dear Students,

Please note the *venue has been changed to A-221*. Apologies for the
inconvenience and thank you for understanding.

On Sat, Sep 6, 2025 at 3:28â€¯PM NSS IIT Hyderabad <office.nss@iith.ac.in>
wrote:

> Dear Students,
>
> Hope you are doing well!
>
> *NSS IIT Hyderabad is pleased to announce an Offline Essay Writing and
> Drawing Competition.*
> As a new initiative this year, we are focusing on the lesser-known aspects
> of the Indian Constitution and the hidden applications of its Articles that
> often go unnoticed. We have also been sharing a series of related posts on
> our social media platforms. Continuing this effort, we are now organizing
> an *Essay Writing Competition* on constitutional themes, along with a *Drawing
> Competition* on cleanliness awareness.
>
> We invite all interested students to participate in this event and
> showcase their creativity and perspectives, whether by exploring the hidden
> applications of the Constitutional Articles through essays or by spreading
> awareness on cleanliness through drawings.
> *Event Details:*
>
> ğŸ“… *Date:* 7th September 2025
> â° *Time:* 4:30 PM â€“ 6:00 PM
> ğŸ“ *Venue: ALH1 & ALH2. *
> *Essay Writing Competition:*
>
> *Theme *
>
> *Article 24 â€“ Prohibition of Child Labour in Hazardous Employment:*
>
> *Topic: â€œWhy a 14-year-old cannot work in a factory but can help in a
> family business.â€*
>
> *Word Limit:* 1000 â€“ 1500 words
> ğŸ“Œ *Note: Mobile phones are not allowed during the competition.*
> *Drawing Competition:*
>
> *Theme:*
>
> *â€œMy Campus, My Responsibilityâ€* â€“ cleanliness in hostels, classrooms,
> and surroundings.
>
> Participants may use images from the internet as references.
>
> ğŸ“Œ *Note: Please bring your drawing materials. You may bring your drawing
> sheets, or A4 sheets will be provided.*
>
> *This competition is open to all students, and participation hours will be
> allotted under Category 2.*
>
> We look forward to your enthusiastic participation in making this event a
> success!
>
> --
> ---------------------------Regards---------------------------
> [image: Photo]
>
> nss.iith.ac.in/
> National Service Scheme (NSS)
> Indian Institute Of Technology, Hyderabad
> +91 7013561424 | 9490313586,

subject: Lunar Eclipse Observation Session
from: "'Cepheid Astronomy club' via Students, IIT Hyderabad" <students@iith.ac.in>
body:
Dear Astronomy and Astrophysics Enthusiasts,

We hope this email finds you well and full of curiosity about the mysteries
of the universe!

 Prepare for a once-in-a-lifetime celestial show! Cepheid, the Astronomy
Club of IITH, is excited to extend a special invitation to you for an
exclusive observation session of the Total Lunar Eclipse, a rare event that
will grace the night sky tomorrow, *September 7th, 2025*.
 Our telescopes will be aimed on the moon , providing stunning, close-up
views. No prior knowledge is required, just bring your sense of wonder!

Here are the details:

   -

   *Date:* Sunday, September 7, 2025
   -

   *Venue:* C-Block Terrace
   -

   *Time:* 10:00 PM to 11:30 PM

*Important Note on Timing:*

   -

   *Partial Eclipse Begins:* ~9:57 PM.
   -

   *Total Eclipse (Blood Moon) Begins:* ~11:00 PM.
   -

   *Maximum Eclipse:* ~11:41 PM

We're thrilled at the prospect of taking a cosmic break with you. This is a
perfect opportunity to step away from your studies and connect with the
cosmos. We can't wait to share this incredible experience with you.

See you under the moonlit (and shadowed) sky!

Clear skies,
[image: Photo]

<https://chat.whatsapp.com/JzWuqr7mWAU38UIkyC9r3V>
<https://www.instagram.com/cepheid_iith/>
<https://www.youtube.com/@CepheidAstronomyclubiith>
<https://www.linkedin.com/in/cepheid-astronomy-and-astrophysics-club-at-iith-25279a112/>



*CEPHEID*



*The Astronomy Club*

IIT Hyderabad

cepheid@gymkhana.iith.ac.in

+91 77383 50253

+91 76191 14781

--

subject: Re: [Internship] Media.net | Senior Product Analyst Intern â€“ Registration
body:
Dear All,
Hope you are doing well.

We are pleased to inform you that the Online Assessment (OA) for *Media.net*
is scheduled as part of the ongoing internship drive. Kindly find the
details below:

   -

   *Date:* Monday, 8th September 2025
   -

   *Time:* 7:30 PM â€“ 8:40 PM
   -

   *Registration Window:* Students may log in on the test portal before
   8:00 PM. The test will be live only from 8:00 PM to 8:40 PM.

*Important Instructions:*

   -

   The test will be strictly proctored, and any misconduct will be treated
   seriously.
   -

   Venue details and seating arrangements will be shared in due course of
   time.

Warm Regards,

*Sarvesh Goyal*
Internship Coordinator, OCS
Indian Institute of Technology Hyderabad
Phone: +91-92852-83563

Hey Everyone,

The selections for *Fashion at Inter-IIT Culturals 8.0* are now open!

IIT Hyderabad will be participating in this yearâ€™s edition hosted at *IIT
Kanpur*, and we are looking for passionate participants to represent us.

There are *two exciting opportunities* this time:

*1. Online Modeling Competition*
A themed shoot showcasing style, creativity, and individuality. This will
be conducted online and requires participants who can bring fashion to life
through expressive posing and visual storytelling.

*2. Fashion Show*
An on-ground show where we need:

subject: New announcement: "Somebody wanted.a notationalâ€¦"
body:
Notification settings  
<https://accounts.google.com/AccountChooser?continue=https://classroom.google.com/s?email%3Des23btech11011@iith.ac.in&Email=es23btech11011@iith.ac.in>
CS5590/CS3390  
<https://accounts.google.com/AccountChooser?continue=https://classroom.google.com/c/Nzk0MzE1NDE4OTU1?email%3Des23btech11011@iith.ac.in&Email=es23btech11011@iith.ac.in>
New announcement

Somebody wanted.a notational clarification, which may help all .. so posting

For surrogate losses we overloaded notation. while loss takes two labels,  
surrogate losses take as input reals so we used notation like l(f(x),y)  
i.e., l( sign(g(x),y)  but actually it is a function of g(x) and y . This  
is just for notational convinience. Otherwise l(sign(g(x),y) cannot  
represent a surrogate like hinge loss as arguments take only label values.  
in summary, when we write l ( sign(g(x), y ) we actually mean a function of  
g(x) and y, which is according to the surrogate. Hope this clarifies. This  
notation was used in summary notes too.
See details  
<https://accounts.google.com/AccountChooser?continue=https://classroom.google.com/c/Nzk0MzE1NDE4OTU1/p/ODAyMjY4MDU1OTc2?email%3Des23btech11011@iith.ac.in&Email=es23btech11011@iith.ac.in>
Posted on 3:51 PM, Sep 6 (GMT+05:30) by Saketha Nath Jagarlapudi

subject: Offline Essay Writing & Drawing Competition â€“ 7th September 2025.
body:
Dear Students,

Hope you are doing well!

*NSS IIT Hyderabad is pleased to announce an Offline Essay Writing and
Drawing Competition.*
As a new initiative this year, we are focusing on the lesser-known aspects
of the Indian Constitution and the hidden applications of its Articles that
often go unnoticed. We have also been sharing a series of related posts on
our social media platforms. Continuing this effort, we are now organizing
an *Essay Writing Competition* on constitutional themes, along with a *Drawing
Competition* on cleanliness awareness.

We invite all interested students to participate in this event and showcase
their creativity and perspectives, whether by exploring the hidden
applications of the Constitutional Articles through essays or by spreading
awareness on cleanliness through drawings.
*Event Details:*

ğŸ“… *Date:* 7th September 2025
â° *Time:* 4:30 PM â€“ 6:00 PM
ğŸ“ *Venue: ALH1 & ALH2. *
*Essay Writing Competition:*

*Theme *

*Article 24 â€“ Prohibition of Child Labour in Hazardous Employment:*

*Topic: â€œWhy a 14-year-old cannot work in a factory but can help in a
family business.â€*

*Word Limit:* 1000 â€“ 1500 words
ğŸ“Œ *Note: Mobile phones are not allowed during the competition.*
*Drawing Competition:*

*Theme:*

*â€œMy Campus, My Responsibilityâ€* â€“ cleanliness in hostels, classrooms, and
surroundings.

Participants may use images from the internet as references.

ğŸ“Œ *Note: Please bring your drawing materials. You may bring your drawing
sheets, or A4 sheets will be provided.*

*This competition is open to all students, and participation hours will be
allotted under Category 2.*

We look forward to your enthusiastic participation in making this event a
success!

-- 
---------------------------Regards---------------------------

subject: INTER IIT ğŸ†ğŸ’ª: WORD GAMES APPLICATION
body:
Hey everyone,

The selections for *Word Games* at *Inter-IIT Culturals 8.0* are now open!

We are looking for participants to represent IIT Hyderabad in the upcoming
edition hosted at IIT Kanpur. If you have prior experience in the following
events, please do apply through the form below:

*Cryptic Crossword*
A crossword puzzle where each clue is a word puzzle in itself, involving
definitions, anagrams, hidden words, or other forms of wordplay. The solver
has to interpret the clues correctly to fill the grid.

*Scrabble*
A board game in which players use letter tiles to form words on a grid.
Each letter carries a score, and players aim to maximize their points by
placing words strategically on premium squares.

*Sacred Word Games*
A set of word-based puzzles and challenges (such as anagrams, word
rearrangements, or logical word problems) conducted under a fixed time
limit. These are designed to test vocabulary, reasoning, and quick thinking.

Fill the form here: FORM LINK <https://forms.gle/WkdxkgCHCLG3yPy48>


*Deadline to fill the form: 11:59 PM, Sunday (07 September 2025)*
Those who have filled the form will be sent a mail separately regarding
further process after the deadline is over. For any queries, please reach
out to Rohith (7538867625).

Thanks & Regards,
*Navin Joshi*
Cultural And Literary Secretary,
Student Gymkhana 2025 - 2026
+91 9340256954
<https://www.instagram.com/culturals.iith/>

--

subject: Re: Apply for Bharat Innovates 2026, Nice, France Event
body:
Dear All, this is a gentle reminder.
Regards,
Malla

On Sat, Aug 30, 2025 at 6:32â€¯AM Dean Innovation, IITH (C Malla Reddy) <
dean.innovation@iith.ac.in> wrote:

> Dear All,
>
> Bharat Innovates 2026 is an initiative of the Ministry of Education,
> Government of India. The program aims to represent Indiaâ€™s R&D backed
> technology innovation prowess, being nurtured at its HEIs / CFTIs, on the
> global stage.
>
> https://bharatinnovates.in/about-us
> https://x.com/BharatInnov2026/status/1961441253645832332
>
> The event held at France, seeks to curate and present approximately 100
> promising and path-breaking technology innovations at various stages of
> development to a global audience comprising industry personnel, investors,
> policymakers, potential collaborators, and technology partners.
>
> All innovators from IITH's ecosystem with strong R&D contributions from
> IITH's faculty/students are encouraged to apply using the google sheet
> below. Shortlisting at Institute Level will be done before forwarding to
> the next level. *Please check the Eligibility Criteria on the website
> before filling the form.*
>

>
> Best regards,

subject: Security information for student organized events
body:
Dear Students,

I hope you are aware of the recent racing bike event, which was not
organized appropriately.
In case of any unwanted situation, it will be challenging to manage the
crowd/vehicles' movement/parking with the current resources.

The student coordinators usually come with the approval of the concerned
FIC/faculty without the liability and responsibility for unwanted cases.
At the end, we get a sorry email from the organizers after damaging the
reputation of IITH.

If you arrange any event as a coordinator, the security section here will
help you conduct the same. But, first, please consult with CSO to assess
the security requirements, which depend on the number of participants,
vehicle entries, vehicle parking, etc. Approval must be obtained from
FIC(Security) by the coordinator well before time, subject to following the
appropriate security arrangements suggested by the CSO. The coordinator and
organizers will be responsible for any unwanted situation.


Further, the following orders from the competent authority has to be
followed without fail.
-------
1. Any activity by the students related to sports should be recommended by
the FIC (Sports) with a clear proposal on the details of the participants,
program and funds/sponsorship and should be approved by the Dean(students)
in a written form.

2.  Any activity by the students other than sports should be recommended by
the FIC (SA)/FIC(students' club) with a clear proposal on the details of
the participants, program and funds/sponsorship and should be approved by
the Dean(students) in a written form.
----------
The commercial nature and outside agency participation of the event have to
be declared.
Please avoid bringing a large number of participants, and note that we
can't deal with any number of outside participants without appropriate
preparation.
Further, please do not expect the approval if requested just a few hours
before the event.

bcc all students and faculties for information.

Best
Prof. Bhabani Shankar Mallik
FIC (Security)

--

subject: Fwd: TRIALS FOR INTER IIT LAWN TENNIS
body:
FYI

---------- Forwarded message ---------
From: Vivaswan Rai <es24btech11040@iith.ac.in>
Date: Fri, 5 Sept, 2025, 18:59
Subject: TRIALS FOR INTER IIT LAWN TENNIS
To: Kowsith Gurubilli <sports_secy@gymkhana.iith.ac.in>
Cc: Vikram Pratap Singh <vikram.bundela@admin.iith.ac.in>, Department of
Sports, IIT Hyderabad <office.sports@iith.ac.in>


Dear students,

We are excited to announce the trials for the forming of the Menâ€™s and
Womenâ€™s Lawn Tennis Team for the upcoming Inter IIT sports meet scheduled
to be held in December 2025. The trial will be conducted under the guidance
of Vikram Sir and is open to all students.


Kindly note the details of the timings of the trials:


Date: 13th and 14th of September (Saturday and Sunday)

Timings: 4:00 pm to 6:00 pm

Venue: Tennis Court (near old sports complex)


We encourage all interested students to participate and showcase their
talent.

This is a great opportunity to play competitive tennis and represent our
institute.


For any queries, contact:

Vivaswan: 8052880844


Best regards,


Vivaswan Rai,

Coordinator, Lawn Tennis IITH

subject: Thanks for taking the  UiPath - Software Engineer Intern - DHiring (Batch'26)
body:
UiPath - Software Engineer Intern - DHiring (Batch'26) - Submission Confirmation


Hello,

Thanks for completing ** UiPath - Software Engineer Intern - DHiring (Batch'26)**. We've sent your submission to **UiPath - Robotic Process Automation**.

In the meantime, you can go ahead and solve more of such code challenges on [HackerRank](https://www.hackerrank.com/dashboard?h_r=hrw&h_l=confirmation_email&utm_source=hrw&utm_campaign=confirmation_domains&utm_medium=email). Solving code challenges is a great way to keep your skills sharp for interviews.  
    
Wish you all the best for your test result! ğŸ¤  
    
This is an automated message. Please **do not** reply to this. You'll need to contact **UiPath - Robotic Process Automation** directly for any follow-up questions.

Thanks,  
** HackerRank Team**



PS: HackerRank only provides a platform to conduct the challenges. It does not schedule or evaluate
any hiring challenges or conduct interviews for any company. Please directly contact the company
that sent you the invite for such purposes.

subject: Re: Registration Open: UiPath â€“ Software Engineer Intern (Female Candidates Only)
body:
Dear All,

Please note that the *branch eligibility is now open to all branches* and
there is *no CGPA barrier* for this opportunity.

We encourage all interested and eligible students to register at the
earliest. A reminder that this internship is* open exclusively to female
candidates*.

Regards,

Harsh Vardhan Singh

On Fri, Sep 5, 2025 at 1:55â€¯AM Harsh Vardhan Singh <
ep23btech11012@iith.ac.in> wrote:

> Dear All,
>
> I hope this message finds you well.
>
> We are pleased to inform you that *UiPath* is inviting applications for
> the *Software Engineer Intern* role as part of the ongoing internship
> drive. This opportunity is *open exclusively to female candidates*.
>
> *Position:* Software Engineer Intern
> *Eligible Branches:* B.Tech â€“ CS/IT and relevant branches
> *Graduating Year:* 2027
> *Eligibility:* CGPA 7.0 and above
> *Stipend:* INR 1,50,000 per month
> *Relocation Support:* INR 1,00,000
> *Location:* Bangalore / Hyderabad
>
> *Registration:*
> All interested and eligible students are required to register via the
> following Google Form <https://forms.gle/Xycsm2PWmLDwyyZ66>
>
> *Deadline to Register:* *5th September 2025, 2:00 PM*
>
> *Online Assessment:* *5th September 2025, 7:00 PM* (Further details will
> be shared shortly)
>
> *Note:* The HR team has informed us that the positions may be opened to
> all candidates at a later stage.
>
> *PFA* the JD for the same
>
> Regards,
>
> Harsh Vardhan Singh; 9449578710
>

--

subject: Total Power Cut off on 06.09.25 ( Saturday ) from 0630 H to 0730Hrs for upcoming Solar Power Generation Plant-reg
body:
Dear all,

Under the provision of Solar Power Generation at IITH campus, a new 550 KVA
Compact substation is  coming up at Parking No.1 ( Main Gate). Laying of
HT 11KV cable from CSS to MRS 11 KV panel room is in progress. Part of the
Cable ( near about 50 meter)  has to be laid inside of the Distribution 11
KV HT panel at MRS.
The said 11 KV HT UG Cable is to be drawn through the existing tunnel which
is having other feeder HT Cables in live mode.

As a factor of safety a power shut down is required for one hour  to
complete this work.

*Hence there will be NO power to the entire Campus from 0630 Hrs to 0730
Hrs on 06.09.2025  ( Saturday ). *

During this power shutdown NO main power (EB)  and NO DG Backup will be
available across the IITH campus .

However one lift in each of the existing FTs and STs  will be functional on
emergency back up.

In view of the above it is requested to kindly plan your activities
accordingly

Cooperation of all is solicited.

Thank You

With Regards,
Altaf Hussain
AE ( Elect)
CMD, IIT Hyderabad
*8500066866 *

*Construction and Maintenance Division, *
*Indian Institute of Technology, Hyderabad. *
*Kandi, Sangareddy (Dist), **Telangana,*
*Landline no. 040-2301 6796.*

--

subject: Sunshine's Suicide Prevention Week 2025: A Week of Hope and Connection at IITH
from: "'Sunshine IIT Hyderabad' via Students, IIT Hyderabad" <students@iith.ac.in>
body:
Dear IITH Community,

In observance of *World Suicide Prevention Day on September 10th*,
Sunshine, the Counselling Cell is hosting *"Suicide Prevention Week 2025"*
from September 8th to September 12th.

This week is dedicated to raising awareness, fostering a supportive
community, and encouraging open conversations about mental health and
well-being. We believe that through collective action and connection, we
can create an environment on campus where everyone feels seen, heard, and
supported.

We invite you all to participate in the weekâ€™s activities. Your presence
and engagement can make a profound difference.

*Schedule of Events:*

Date

Day

Event

Time

Venue

Sept 8th

Monday

Random Acts of Kindness

*5:30pm*

New Mess Lawns

Sept 9th

Tuesday

Random Acts of Kindness

*5:30pm*

Near Library and LHC

Sept 10th

Wednesday

*Sunshine Strides*

*6:00 AM*

Hostel Circle to IITH Main Gate

Sept 10th

Wednesday

Heal Out Loud

*5:30pm*

*TBD*

Sept 11th

Thursday

Random Acts of Kindness

*5:30pm*

Old Mess Lawns

Sept 12th

Friday

Random Acts of Kindness

*5:30pm*

Near C Block and CSE building


*About Our Events:*

   -

   Random Acts of Kindness: Participate in a unique experience of
   connection. Share a kind note with a stranger and witness the simple power
   of a positive message.
   -

   Sunshine Strides: Start the day with a refreshing *morning walk* to
   promote mental and physical well-being and stand in solidarity as a
   community. To register, please Click here
   <https://docs.google.com/forms/d/e/1FAIpQLSdU3oGD0ugyKmAd0RVHRZMEeNdln7eKp1EwhdGNXJoPCwJp8w/viewform>
   -

   Heal Out Loud: An open mic session facilitated by Sunshine. This is a
   safe and non- judgmental open space for sharing stories, life experiences
   or thoughts related to your mental health journeys. Lend your voice or your
   ear in an evening of community and catharsis.

All events are open to every member of the IITH community.

*For Event-Related Queries*

   -

   Name: *please contact the Counsellors*
   -

   Contact:* 8331036080,8331036081,8330136082*

Let us come together to create hope through action. We look forward to your
participation.

Warm regards,

Sunshine Team

--

Inter IIT Comedy Trials ğŸ†ğŸ’ª - Stand-up and Improv
body:
*Inter IIT Comedy Trials*

*The coolest among the culturals.*

Stand-up and improv comedy trials are beginning, and weâ€™re kicking things
off with *online submissions* to judge your roasting and humour talent.

Youâ€™ll need to attach a *video clip* to the form linked below. *Choose your
own topic and roast it*, up to a *maximum of 3 minutes*. Look into the
camera, and *make it unscripted*. Why? Because I can read you. I know when
itâ€™s real, your expressions, your pauses, your genuine energy, thatâ€™s what
matters.

*Because, When you hold the mic, you hold the audience.*
You have the authority to *manipulate their thoughts*, not with lies, but
with words, confidence, and timing.

*Humour isnâ€™t about jokes, itâ€™s about perspective.*
The same things we all see, *you must say differently.* Everyone knows the
world is broken, only you know *how to break it better*.

*Look into their eyes.*
Fear is temporary. *Your impact, Permanent.*
Youâ€™re not just a good person to interact with, you're the *best person to
entertain. And that matters.*

Letâ€™s begin with trials. Submit your entries.

*Remember:*
Roasting isnâ€™t joking, itâ€™s speaking the *unsaid truth*.
Funny? Good.
Serious? Iconic

I hope youâ€™ve got the idea by now. Itâ€™s time to tackle your fear of the
stage, introversion (like me, myself), and that *unchallenged attitude* you've
been sitting on for too long.

Letâ€™s show people what you can be, and what youâ€™ve always had to say, with
the *perfect confidence and zero fear* of the listeners.
------------------------------

Thatâ€™s all.
I used my GPT free trial till here, and to explain more, itâ€™s asking me to
upgrade to premium.


*Not gonna happen.Form Link : *https://forms.gle/oX9YvcsTpUN3uhm27
*Deadline : Sunday , 7 Sept ' 25*

Thanks and regards,
*Shubham Dadhich*
8741879391
Comedy Cup Captain,
*Inter IIT Cultural Meet 8.0*
--------------------------------------------

Thanks & Regards,
*Navin Joshi*
Cultural And Literary Secretary,
Student Gymkhana 2025 - 2026
+91 9340256954
<https://www.instagram.com/culturals.iith/>

--

>

> prestigious competition, which will be happening at IIT Kanpur this year.
> If interested, do apply through the form regardless of previous writing
> experience.
>
> A list of events is given below, with a brief description provided.
>
>    - *Creative Writing*: Prose writing (essay, story, letter, play etc.)
>    with a time limit of 4 hours and theme/prompts given on-spot.
>    - *Poetry Writing*: Any rhyming scheme as well as free verse poem is
>    acceptable. Event will have a time limit of 4 hours and on-spot theme.
>    - *Slam Poetry*: Poetry along with recitation. No theme or time limit
>    provided for writing the poem, judging is based on quality of writing and
>    oration.
>    - *Plot Paradox*: Includes choosing a book and reimagining its story
>    briefly in a completely different genre, while retaining the original
>    characters and key plot points.

subject: Special Dinner on 5th September, 2025
body:
Dear Students,

You may already be aware that IIT Hyderabad has been ranked 7th in the NIRF
2025 Engineering rankings. This is a significant milestone for our
Institute, placing us on par with the first-generation IITs. To celebrate
this occasion, a special dinner will be served in the mess on September 5,
2025.

Warm regards,
Prasanth
------
R Prasanth Kumar

subject: Launch of Hostel Complaints Google Form- Kind Attention
body:
Dear Student,

We hope you are doing well.

This is to inform you that a *Google Form for Hostel Complaints* has been
launched to streamline the process of addressing issues in the hostels.

*Please note:*

   -

   *Only complaints submitted through this form will be considered.- Hostel
   complaints form <https://forms.gle/qhpcaTN4oLzabTes5>*
   -

   The complaint form is available on the *Hostels website*.-HCU
   <https://hostel.iith.ac.in/complaints>

The step by step procedure and feasibility with this complaint form are
provided below for your reference.

1.  This form will be enabled only for candidates who have been allotted
hostels.

2. Any complaint related to the various issues (like Civil, Electrical,
Room, Water Purifier, Washing machine,Pest control, Carpenter, LAN,
Hygiene, Furniture etc. ) can be raised through this complaint form only.

3. After raising the complaint , a unique complaint ID (example:
*HC-CIV-250904-VHM-0320-000000)* will be created for the complaint raised
and will get the acknowledgement on the same to your mail id.

4. You can track the status of the complaint with the help of complaint ID
and there is no need to send the mail separately for the status of the
complaint.

5. Once the complaint has been resolved, you will get the email and you can
acknowledge the same.

We encourage you to make use of this system for faster and more organised
resolution of hostel-related complaints.

*NOTE: Kindly refrain from sending emails regarding hostel-related issues
to the office.hostel@iith.ac.in <office.hostel@iith.ac.in> email ID.
Instead, please use the designated form provided for this purpose.*

Thank you for your cooperation.

subject: Fwd: [Shizuoka Univ.] International Exchange Program Spring 2026 Announcement
body:
Dear Students,

The following is the opportunity  announced by  Shizuoka University, Japan!.

Kindly check the complete details and apply if interested.
Please see the links below for the fact sheet and additional information.
 https://www.suoic.shizuoka.ac.jp/english/international/exchange-student/


Becoming Exchange Student
https://www.suoic.shizuoka.ac.jp/english/international/exchange-student
/becomingexs
FAQ
https://www.suoic.shizuoka.ac.jp/english/international/exchange-student
/faqexs
Student Testimonials
https://www.suoic.shizuoka.ac.jp/international/exchange-student
/student_testimonials

The nominations with the below information and  approval letter  by your
HoD / Supervisor / Department  should reach us by *15:00 , 22nd September* .
As we have to send only 3 nominations from IITH there would be shortlisting
done bycommitte


Name Department Roll NO Mobile number  CGPA Do you have a valid Passport
currently
  Mention your Passport Number and Validity

For any Query Please fil this form by , 12th September . we will answer
periodically .

https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/1iRoHJonRPL7k8k6ISfiI33GxSy_bA8IuojJRPYf0ZHk/edit?gid=1368971935#gid=1368971935


Please note : The Approval Letter from your Supervisor or HoD for the
period spent in Japan is necessary  to  consider your nominations to
Shizuoka .
**Shizuoka University accepts student applications through our partner
universities
<https://www.suoic.shizuoka.ac.jp/english/aboutus/list-of-partner-schools-between-universities/>.
Direct applications from students will not be accepted.*

Regards
Pranitha.A

Dear Partners,

(Please extend this email to the appropriate colleagues)



Warm greetings from Shizuoka University, Japan!

We are excited to announce that nominations for the Spring 2026
International Exchange Program are now open!



Please see the links below for the fact sheet and additional information.

(English)
https://www.suoic.shizuoka.ac.jp/english/international/exchange-student/

(Japanese) https://www.suoic.shizuoka.ac.jp/international/exchange-student/



Becoming Exchange Student

https://www.suoic.shizuoka.ac.jp/english/international/exchange-student/becomingexs

FAQ

https://www.suoic.shizuoka.ac.jp/english/international/exchange-student/faqexs

Student Testimonials

https://www.suoic.shizuoka.ac.jp/international/exchange-student/student_testimonials





1. Acceptable number of students: up to* 3*

(The number on the basis of our agreement.)

The number of students that can be accepted is calculated by subtracting
the students who will continue their exchange from the Fall semester of 2025.
If you have any questions, please feel free to contact us.



2. Nomination (Deadline: October 1, 2025)

Please include the following information in your email and send it to us.

-       Nominee name(s)

-       Email address(es) of the nominee(s)

-       Term(s) in which the nominee(s) intend to study at our university.



Nominees may choose to study for either one semester or two semesters.

One term: 6 months (from April 1, 2026 to September 30, 2026)

Two terms: 1year (from April 1, 2026 to March 31, 2027)



e.g.

Mr. ***** ***** *****, XXXX@XXXX, 1 term

Ms. ********** *****, xxxx@xxxxx, 2terms

* Nominations will only be accepted through the partner university office
via email.





3. Application (Deadline: October 14, 2025)

*The application procedure has been revised starting this time.*

Each nominated student is expected to complete the application individually
through the *online system*. Detailed instructions will be provided
separately to the nominated students.



4. Result

The results will be announced in December



We sincerely thank you in advance for your great cooperation.

If you have any questions, please feel free to contact us.



Best regards,
--

subject: Fwd: [UOsaka_re-sending] University-wide incoming exchange programs 2026 Spring intake
body:
Dear Students,

Greetings !

The following is the information regarding the *Osaka University (OU)* exchange
program for students ,  *2026 Spring** intake.*
*Exchange study tracks (* *2026 Spring*  *intake): iExPO, OUSSEP,
FrontierLab, Maple*
*Maximum number of students to receive (2025 Spring intake) : 2*
*IITH's Nomination deadline:  14:00 , Septemebr 15th , 2025*

Please download the application guide for students and coordinators from
the following link, which is also available to download from the log-in
page of the online system.



[Nomination information guides]

https://filesender.nii.ac.jp/?s=download&token=936fee3b-beec-4bc3-870e-b609855d62d1
*Once we check &  finalize the nominations . The initial authentication
password for the further(online application) process would be given by our
office(**only to the selected students) **.*

We would like to settle the above  deadline and *no extension is possible*
 .
 It is mandatory for your HoD/ Department / supervisor to approve your
durations  of time spent at Osaka University( for this program)   hence
forward it with their approval .  The *Approval Letter* from your
Supervisor or HoD for the period spent in Japan is necessary .


*It is recommended to read all the details in the attachment & website
thoroughly(FaQ's Videos etc.)  , don't expect response for  queries that
are already explained clearly *.
For any further queries you may kindly reach out to our coordinator copied
on the mail  first .

Excel sheet for queries  :

https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/1iRoHJonRPL7k8k6ISfiI33GxSy_bA8IuojJRPYf0ZHk/edit?gid=1368971935#gid=1368971935


. We will answer all queries as one FAQ response to this thread . To
encourage you to read much before the deadline and avoid  last minute rush
, the last date for filling / asking queries is *10.09.25*

University contact :  exchange@ciee.osaka-u.ac.jp .


Regards
Pranitha.A



Dear Partner,



Greetings from the University of Osaka.




We are happy to inform you that our online application web page is now
ready to nominate university-wide exchange students *for 2026 Spring
intake.*

*The University of Osaka currently receives exchange applications for
university-wide programs twice a year, for September and April intake.
Please DO NOT nominate stuÂ­dents for 2027 Fall intake at this time.*

*Please note that we may not be able to accept all nominated students if
the number of stuÂ­dents in each program exceeds capacity to accommodate. We
appreciate your underÂ­standing on this matter in advance.*



Please download the application guide for students and coordinators from
the following link, which is also available to download from the log-in
page of the online system.



[Nomination information guides]

https://filesender.nii.ac.jp/?s=download&token=936fee3b-beec-4bc3-870e-b609855d62d1




Contract type: University-Wide

Exchange study tracks (2026 Spring intake): iExPO, OUSSEP, FrontierLab

Maximum number of students to receive 2026Spring intake : 5

Nomination deadline: September 30, 2025

Studentâ€™s application deadline: October 13, 2025

Student authentication password: AJ5gAGrL



*Please inform necessary application materials to your students well in
advance, especially language proficiency score/certificate and give the
initial authentication password to the nominated students.*

When you submit your nomination online, an instruction email will be sent
to your students. The application guide and forms are all available to
download from the studentâ€™s personal apÂ­plication web page.



[Number of Accepted International Students for the University-Wide Exchange
Program]

We start counting the exchange place from September in our university-wide
incoming student exchange programs. We basically consider the total number
of students sent from your instituÂ­tion in a year from September to August,
regardless of full-year or half year study.



If you need further information about your sending students or online
nomination, please conÂ­tact us at exchange@ciee.osaka-u.ac.jp .



We are looking forward to your nomination!



Best Regards,

------------------------------------------------

The University of Osaka

University-wide Student Exchange - Inbound team International Student
Affairs Division

subject: IITH is at 7th rank in NIRF Engineering.
body:
Dear friends,
You are all aware that we have been at 8th rank, behind the 7 first gen
IITs for quite some time. We have always been dreaming of breaking this
barrier. Today we realised our dream and got 7th rank in engineering today.
We have crossed an IIT, which is 13 years older than us (IIT Guwahati).

Today is a very special day for all of us. The credit goes to all of you,
faculty, students and staff. Thank you so much for your passionate
contributions to your institution.

Let's keep moving forward with a commitment to excel and make IITH the
dream destination for everyone.

warm regards,
Murty

Dear Students,

This is to inform you all that due to exams scheduled for first year
students we have postponed the trials to *Friday evening - 05/09/2025 .*

We are excited to announce the trials for probables of forming the Menâ€™s &
Women's Basketball team for the upcoming Inter IIT Sports Meet scheduled to
be held in the month of December at IIT Madras. The trials will be
conducted under the guidance of our Coach Ms Ruchi Yadav and are open to
all students.

Kindly note the updated timings of the trials.

 Details of the Trials:

 Date: *05.09.2025 (Friday)*
Time: *5:00 pm to 7:00 pm*
Venue: SNCC Basketball Court
Dress Code: Shorts & T-shirt
Sportswear with non-marking shoes (Mandatory)

The selected players will constitute the official Institute Basketball
Team, which will represent our institute at the Inter IIT Sports Meet as
well as in practice matches and other tournaments throughout the year. The
team will also have daily training sessions to prepare for the upcoming
tournaments.

We encourage all interested students to participate to showcase their
talent. This is a great opportunity to play competitive basketball and
represent our institute. We sincerely invite you all on behalf of our coach
and the old team members, and we look forward to your participation.

Please note that the SNCC Basketball Court will be reserved for Inter IIT
team practice from today (04.09.2025) until December, from 6:30 PM to 9:00
PM daily.

New announcement

Important instructions for all exams:
1. Reach atleast 10minutes before the exam to the venue.
2. Dont carry any mobile/electronic-gadget/book/notes. You need to only  
bring your ID card and pen/pencil and nothing else.
3. If an invigilator finds that there is a  
mobile/electronic-gadget/book/notes that is withinyour reach during the  
exam (for e.g., switched o phone in your pocket), then you will
be awarded zero marks in this quiz (even if you are not using the resource).
4. If you are found to be using any of these resources orany other unfair  
means, it will lead to a fail grade as announced earlier.
5. Writing beyond announced end time will result in zero marks for the  
quiz. So please immediately stop writing answers as soon as the invigilator  
announces so.
6. Usually question paper is distributed few minutes before so that you can  
read all the instructions in the question paper.

subject: Fwd: Scholarship for girl students pursuing professional graduation courses| Kotak Kanya Scholarship 2025-26
body:
Dear Students,

Forwarded for your information.  Interested and eligible students may
apply, others, please ignore this email.

*Note:* Students should avail only a single scholarship / stipend /
financial aid, only from a single stakeholder for a given period i.e.
Students cannot avail multiple scholarships / financial assistance from
multiple stakeholders (Govt. / Private / any external agencies) for the
same academic year.

From: Buddy4Study <info@buddy4study.live>
Date: Wed, 3 Sept, 2025, 15:00
Subject: Scholarship for girl students pursuing professional graduation
courses| Kotak Kanya Scholarship 2025-26
To: Dr. Sayantee Jana <sayantee.jana@math.iith.ac.in>


*Scholarship of INR 1.5 lakh per year | Requesting support for the
circulation of this message *

Dear Dr. Sayantee Jana ,

Greetings of the day!

We hope you received our previous communication regarding the *Kotak Kanya
Scholarship 2025-26. *The scholarship is currently open for girl students
who have completed Class 12 and are currently enrolled in government
schools/colleges.

Program details are shared below for your reference.

*Eligibility: *

   - Open for meritorious girl students across India.
   - Applicants must have scored 75% or more marks or equivalent CGPA in
   Class 12 board examinations.
   - Applicant's annual family income must be less than INR 6,00,000.
   - Meritorious girl students who have secured admission to the first year
   of graduation programs in the academic year 2025-26 in institutes of repute
   like NIRF/NAAC accredited for professional graduation degrees like
   Engineering, MBBS, Integrated LLB (5 Years), Integrated BS-MS/BS-Research,
   in ISER, IISC(Bangalore), or other professional courses (Design,
   Architecture, etc.).

*Award:* Scholarship of INR 1.5 lakh* per year

*Application Deadline:* September 30, 2025

*Application URL: http://www.b4s.in/a/em_KKGS4_20250624_1
<https://z4cfhqlx.r.us-east-1.awstrack.me/L0/https:%2F%2Fmailer.buddy4study.com%2Fl%2FamKfUP8bdSDJAHPIrPtYoA%2F130ngsZ892HKezaB4mMGf2KA%2FbCaH9bk176364oa8ubeJvBCQ/1/010001990ee9bafc-ea627e34-de0c-4e75-adbf-1d969ee7a902-000000/qtKkPErn-wSfzTXxpi-lbJJVCa4=442>*

*Helpline:  *kotakscholarship@buddy4study.com or 011-430-92248 (Ext-262)

Kindly share this scholarship information with students in your institution
so that they can take advantage of this opportunity. If you have any
queries or need any assistance regarding this scholarship program, please
contact us.

the link below.

subject: UK Governmentâ€™s Fully-Funded Chevening Scholarships & Fellowships - REGISTER NOW for Virtual Awareness Session
body:
Dear Students,

The British High Commission is pleased to announce that applications for
the UK Governmentâ€™s prestigious *Chevening Scholarships and Fellowships*
for the *2026-2027 academic year* are now open!



*Whatâ€™s on offer?*

   - *Fully funded scholarship to study one-year Masterâ€™s *at any UK
   university, in any course of your choice.
   - *Short-term thematic fellowships* in:
      - Leadership
      - Cyber Security
      - South Asia Journalism
      - Science & Research
      - Arts

*ğŸ“… Application Window: **5 August â€“ 7 October 2025*



Know someone with the potential to lead change in their community or
globally? Encourage them to apply and become part of a global network of
future leaders.



*Apply now*: Apply | Chevening <https://www.chevening.org/apply/>



*Join the Info Sessions!*

To support prospective applicants, weâ€™re hosting online sessions packed
with insights on eligibility, the application process, and tips for
success. Hear from the Head of Chevening and get a chance to ask your
questions directly.


*Session Dates:*

subject: Thanks for taking the FY26 | Cisco Day - Online Assessment | Summer Internship | 03 Sep 2025
body:
FY26 | Cisco Day - Online Assessment | Summer Internship | 03 Sep 2025 - Submission Confirmation


Hello,

Thanks for completing **FY26 |Cisco Day - Online Assessment. Summer Internship 03 Sep 2025**. We've sent your submission to **Cisco Systems Inc**.

In the meantime, you can go ahead and solve more of such code challenges on [HackerRank](https://www.hackerrank.com/dashboard?h_r=hrw&h_l=confirmation_email&utm_source=hrw&utm_campaign=confirmation_domains&utm_medium=email). Solving code challenges is a great way to keep your skills sharp for interviews.  
    
Wish you all the best for your test result! ğŸ¤  
    
This is an automated message. Please **do not** reply to this. You'll need to contact **Cisco Systems Inc** directly for any follow-up questions.

Thanks,  
**HackerRank Team**

PS: HackerRank only provides a platform to conduct the challenges. It does not schedule or evaluate
any hiring challenges or conduct interviews for any company. Please directly contact the company
that sent you the invite for such purposes.

>>    - Any unfair means used during the assessment will lead to
>>    elimination from the process and further
>>    - course of action will be taken against the student.
>>    - In case of a power cut or network disconnection, Please ask the
>>    student to resume/rejoin within 30 minutes, or else the test will be
>>    automatically submitted.
>>    - The test will automatically be submitted after 30 minutes of
>>    inactivity on the test screen.

subject: Re: Qurve Orientation 2025
body:
Dear Students,

Due to several requests, we are changing the date for the orientation. The
updated timing will be shared soon.

Thank you,


*With regards,Medha and Akansha,*
*Qurve Overall Coordinators*
<https://www.instagram.com/qurve.iith/>

On Wed, 3 Sept, 2025, 2:47â€¯pm Qurve IIT Hyderabad, <qurve@iith.ac.in> wrote:

> Dear Students,
>
> We are delighted to invite you to the *Orientation of Qurve*, the
> official *LGBTQ+ Alliance of IIT Hyderabad*!
>
> Whether you are a member of the LGBTQ+ community, an ally, or simply
> curious to learn more, this is a *safe and welcoming space* to connect,
> share, and celebrate diversity.
>
> Event Details:
> ğŸ“… Date: 4th September 2025
> ğŸ•’ Time: 6:30 pm - 8:30 pm
> ğŸ“ Venue: A - Block Auditorium
>
> Join us to:
>
>    - Learn about Qurve, our mission, and upcoming initiatives
>    - Meet and interact with fellow students and allies
>    - Explore ways to make our campus a more inclusive and supportive
>    space for everyone
>
> For any queries or if you wish to connect with us, feel free to reach out.
>
> Looking forward to seeing you there!
>
>
> *With regards,Medha and Akansha,*
> *Qurve Overall Coordinators*
> <https://www.instagram.com/qurve.iith/>
>

--

(September 3rd: till 8:30 PM IST) Temporary unavailability of Wi-Fi in Lecture Hall Complex
body:
Dear all,

Due to the critical academic activities which need Wi-Fi to be shut
down in the Lecture Hall Complex, the Wi-Fi access for B.Tech, M.Tech,
Ph.D., Guest, and Eduroam will be terminated today at any moment till
around 8:30 PM IST.

We regret any inconveniences caused by this operation.

Best regards,

kotaro

-- 
Kotaro Kataoka <fic.noc@comp.iith.ac.in>
Faculty in Charge, Network Operation Cell, Computer Centre
Indian Institute of Technology Hyderabad

subject: One Nation One Subscription (ONOS) User Awareness Programme on Unlock the Future of Research: GenAI & ScienceDirect in Scholarly Publishing - REG
body:
Dear Sir/Madam,

It is pleased to announce that INFLIBNET Centre is organising One Nation
One Subscription (ONOS) User Awareness Programme on Unlock the Future of
Research: GenAI & ScienceDirect in Scholarly Publishing in collaboration
with Elsevier on 9th September 2025 at 3 to 4 pm. This session will provide
researchers with a comprehensive understanding of how Generative AI is
reshaping scientific publishing, highlighting both the opportunities and
challenges it presents.

Registration Link:
https://webinars.elsevier.com/elsevier/generative-ai-genai-in-scientific-writing-and-scholarly-publishing-and-sciencedirect-for-onos

*Agenda:*

   - GenAI in Publishing: Opportunities and Concerns
   - Legislative and Policy Landscape for AI
   - Elsevierâ€™s GenAI Policies and Responsible AI Principles
   - Compliance for Authors, Editors, and Reviewers
   - Elsevierâ€™s GenAI-Powered Tools for Researchers and Clinicians
   - Navigating ScienceDirect


*Hosts*:
Prof. Devika Madalli (Director, INFLIBNET), Aishwarya Nayal (Customer
Success Manager, Elsevier), Dr. Anirban Basu (Scientific Editor, Elsevier),
Nicholas Pak (Customer Success Team Manager, South Asia and South-East
Asia, Elsevier)

Regards,
Team KRC

subject: Kiriith, Vol - 7, Issue 1 - Materials Characterisation
body:
Dear all:
Greetings of the day!

We are happy to share KirIITH  Issue 1 of Volume 7-Materials
Characterisation research at IITH.

Sincerely,
Prabhat Kumar

*Director's Desk - Prof B S Murty*

As always, this edition, Vol 7, Issue 1, Jan - Mar 2025 (Issue - 22) is
dedicated to one of IITH's key thrust research areas, "Material
Characterisation". In todayâ€™s rapidly evolving world of technology,
material characterisation plays a vital role in driving innovation,
ensuring reliability, and enhancing performance across industries. As new
materials are developed for cutting-edge applications, from semiconductors
and renewable energy to biomedical devices & aerospace, understanding their
structural, mechanical, electrical, and chemical properties becomes
essential.
*Flip Over* <https://online.fliphtml5.com/vrhdl/vdvf/#p=4>
*Read More* <https://pr.iith.ac.in/newsletter/download/Issue-22.pdf>

Call for Applications â€“ Canteen Monitoring Committee (CMC) Coordinators (2025-26)
from: "'KRISHNA VARDHAN PITLA' via Students, IIT Hyderabad" <students@iith.ac.in>
body:
Dear Students

Hope you are doing well.

We are excited to announce that applications are now open for the *Canteen
Monitoring Committee (CMC) â€“ Coordinator positions for the academic year
2025-26.*

The CMC plays a key role in ensuring smooth operations and continued
improvement of our campus dining spaces. We are looking for committed and
enthusiastic individuals who are eager to contribute, take initiative, and
work in a collaborative environment.

You may apply for a Coordinator position in one of the following domains:


*1. Inspection Team Coordinator**2. Technical Team Coordinator*

*Eligibility Criteria:*

   -

   Minimum CGPA: 6.5
   -

   Must be a full-time registered student of the institute.
   -

   Should have no disciplinary record or negative feedback from
   faculty/staff.
   -

   Should be a positive role model in the student community.

Please go through the *attached document
<https://docs.google.com/document/d/18naDyn_bIKwSfcrIuBxhgC-US5H6z5N5n2R1tB_q0iM/edit?usp=sharing>*
for detailed roles and responsibilities before applying.

We look forward to seeing proactive students step up and make a meaningful
contribution through the CMC.

Form ->
https://docs.google.com/forms/d/e/1FAIpQLSczSjGepoloAtGIWO6o1vXqtmiY-Ec6KzQ3AOydSNBs4KUq2w/viewform?usp=sharing&ouid=113149730704166021925

Best regards,
Thanks & Regards
------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

*Krishna Vardhan Pitla*

*General Secretary-I*

*Student Gymkhana 2025-26*

*Mobile: ** 7989400829*

We are happy to inform you that the IITH Knowledge Resource Centre
(KRC)/Library has subscribed to a wide range of e-resources to support your
learning and research. These include: Full-text databases, e-books, Individual
journals, Bibliographic databases, Online newspapers, and Academic tools.

subject: Re: Register for Cisco Summer Internship Program â€“ Batch of 2027
body:
Dear Students,

Cisco has sent *Online Assessment (OA) invitations via HackerRank* to all
eligible students on their registered email IDs.

ğŸ“Œ *Important Note:*

   -

   If you did not receive the mail, it could be due to *wrong email ID,
   academic arrears, or not being of Indian nationality*.
   -

   Please *check your Spam/Junk folders* as well.

ğŸ“ *Assessment Details:*

   -

   *Date:* 03 September 2025
   -

   *Start Time:* 08:00 PM
   -

   *End Time:* 09:30 PM
   -

   *Duration:* 90 minutes
   -

   *Platform:* HackerRank

ğŸ“Œ *Instructions for Students:*

   - The assessment will consist of coding-based questions; ensure that
   they have a stable internet connection throughout the assessment.
   - The use of any study material, mobile phones, electronic devices,
   media, or internet resources is not
   - allowed during the test.
   - No calculators are allowed. Using a pen and paper is allowed during
   the test.
   - Please ensure that the students have a built-in camera on the system
   they are taking the test from.
   - The test will run on full-screen mode, please ensure that they do not
   exit the window, switch tabs as
   - this may flag as suspicious activity.
   - Any sort of copying, plagiarism, moving out of the tab/window, or
   malpractices will lead to disqualification.
   - The activity during the assessment, including code submissions and
   browser behaviour, may be
   - monitored for integrity checks.
   - Students should refrain from copying code from external sources.
   - Students should avoid switching between tabs or windows during the
   assessment.
   - Any detected irregularities may be subject to further review and could
   impact their assessment outcome.
   - Any unfair means used during the assessment will lead to elimination
   from the process and further
   - course of action will be taken against the student.
   - In case of a power cut or network disconnection, Please ask the
   student to resume/rejoin within 30 minutes, or else the test will be
   automatically submitted.
   - The test will automatically be submitted after 30 minutes of
   inactivity on the test screen.
   - To rejoin the test, the students should use the same email address
   used to register on HackerRank.

ğŸ“Œ *Seating Arrangement:*

Seating arrangement details will be shared shortly.

Best regards,
*B.Lokesh Reddy*

subject: Fwd: Fanpit India Hackathon | Edition 1 | Registrations End September 10, 2025
Your HackerRank FY26 | Cisco Day - Online Assessment | Summer Internship | 03 Sep 2025 Invitation
body:
FY26 | Cisco Day - Online Assessment | Summer Internship | 03 Sep 2025 - powered by HackerRank



  
    
      
        
        
          Hi,

Â 

Thank you for your interest in joining Cisco Systems Inc! We're excited to invite you to the next step in the process: the HackerRank FY26 | Cisco Day - Online Assessment | Summer Internship | 03 Sep 2025 assessment. This is a great opportunity to showcase your skills, and we're here to support you along the way.

Here's what you need to know:


	Timeline: Please complete the assessment as per the timelines shared below.
	Practice Makes Perfect: To help you feel confident, we've included a sample test where you can explore the HackerRank environment and practice before starting the official test.


A few tips for success:


	Create the Right Environment: Set up in a quiet, private space where you can focus.
	Understand Each Question: Take a moment to carefully read each question before diving in.
	Avoid Disruptions: Once you start, complete the test in one uninterrupted session. Avoid refreshing your browser or using the back button to prevent losing progress.


Feel free to reach out to your recruiter if you have any questions.
Wishing you the best of luck with the assessmentâ€”go show us your skills!

Â 

Happy coding,
The Cisco Systems Inc Hiring Team

        
        
      

      

      
        
          
            
              Recommended Browser: Google Chrome v101 or greater
            
          
          
          
             
              Duration: 90 min 
            
            
          
          
          
          Start Login Date/Time:
          
            3 Sep 2025 08:00 PM IST
            
            (Asia - Kolkata)
            
          
          
          
          
          End Login Date/Time: 3 Sep 2025 08:35 PM IST
            
            (Asia - Kolkata)
            
          
          
          
            Start Test
          
          You can also use this
          test link
          to access the test
          
          anytime before the test expiry date above.
          Please check date and time in your time zone.
          
          
        
      
    
  


Please note once you begin the test the timer will start and the test cannot be paused. Hence it is highly recommended that you complete the test in one sitting.

In case of power failure or loss of internet connection, the test timer will continue to run even though you might not be attempting it, in such a case please contact us by replying back to this email.

For any technical queries, please refer to https://track.pstmrk.it/3ts/candidatesupport.hackerrank.com%2Fhc%2Fen-us%2Fcategories%2F4402828710675-FAQ/EDcI/EcW-AQ/AQ/fda9ca9e-417b-4ec5-83de-243916f53ebf/5/lX8LoS3q8X or contact us at https://track.pstmrk.it/3ts/customersupport.hackerrank.com%2Fhc%2Fen-us%2Frequests%2Fnew%3Fticket_form_id%3D360001035834./EDcI/EcW-AQ/AQ/fda9ca9e-417b-4ec5-83de-243916f53ebf/7/V9gt-iOWjx

HackerRank only provides a platform to conduct the tests. It does not schedule or evaluate any hiring tests or conduct interviews for any company. Hence for any of the above requests please contact the company that sent you the invite.

>

> Program for UG Students 2025â€“26*. We invite you to join the program and
> contribute uniquely to the IITH fraternity.
> Who are Sunshine Buddies?
>
> Buddies are fellow students from various academic backgrounds who
> volunteer to be your *go-to contact* for any assistance you may need.
> They are approachable and ready to lend an empathetic ear, offering help on
> social, mental, or academic fronts.
> Benefits of becoming a Buddy:
>

>

>

subject: Important: Add/Drop of Segment Courses (3-4, 3-6 Segment) â€“ Deadline and Guidelines
body:
Dear Students,

This is to inform you that the *Add/Drop process for the
following segment courses has commenced*:

Â·         3-6 Segment

Â·         3-4 Segment

The *deadline for add/drop* will be as per the schedule provided in the
screenshot below:

*Course Drop Process: Students can drop courses using the "Course
Registration" option only until 08th September 2025, while course
registrations are open. From 09th September 2025 onwards, the "Course Drop"
option must be used to drop 3-6 segment courses, as the deadline to drop
3-4 segment courses is 08th September 2025.*

[image: image.png]

 However, please note the following important points:

1.      *Late Registration Penalty*:

o    A penalty of *Rs. 500/- per day* will be imposed for not registering
the course within the deadline,

o    Up to a maximum of *Rs. 5000/-*,

o    With approval from the *Course Instructor, FA/Guide, DPGC/DUGC, and
HOD*.

2.      *No Dropping After Deadline*:

o    Dropping of any course *will not be permitted* after the deadline
under any circumstances.

3.      *Course Eligibility*:

o    It is the *studentâ€™s responsibility* to ensure that they are
*eligible* for
the registered courses.

o    If any *ineligible course is not dropped* before the deadline, it will
lead to an  *â€˜Fail (F)â€™ grade*.

o    Please verify eligibility with the respective *Course Instructor or
Department*.

4.      *Upcoming Segment Courses ( 4-6 / 5-6)*:

o    These courses can be added or dropped during the *respective segmentâ€™s
add/drop period* also.

We request you to complete the add/drop process well before the deadline
and avoid last-minute complications.

subject: Prof. Kiran (EE) and Prof. Krti (CHE) are elected as FNAE
body:
Dear friends,
I am delighted to share the good news that Prof. Kiran Kuchi (EE) and Prof.
Kirti Chandra Sahu (CHE) are elected as Fellows of Indian National Academy
of Engineering (FNAE) for this year. This is a great news to all of us. For
an Engineer, becoming FNAE is a great honor, as INAE is the only
Engineering Academy in India.

On behalf of all of us, I would like to convey my hearty congratulations to
both and their research groups. Wishing both of them many more laurels in
near future.

warm regards,
Murty

subject: Meet ServiceNow 2025 | Mandatory Registration for September 8 Sessions
body:
Dear Students,

Greetings, We are excited to announce that *Meet ServiceNow 2025* will be
hosted on *September 8, 2025*, featuring three engaging sessions for the *2027
graduating batch (B.Tech - *CS, IT & Circuit branches*)*.
Session Details
Session Time Duration
Orientation 10:30 AM â€“ 11:30 AM 60 mins
Interview Readiness 11:50 AM â€“ 12:35 PM 45 mins
Networking (Exclusive) 2:00 PM â€“ 2:45 PM 45 mins
Compulsory Registration

   1.

   *Orientation & Interview Readiness*
   All students attending these sessions must *compulsorily register* using
   the link below:
   ğŸ”— Register for Meet ServiceNow 2025 Orientation | IIT Hyderabad

subject: KRC: Invitation to USER AWARENESS WORKSHOP on Sage resources at KRC-Ground Floor-AVRoom-1 on 03-09-2025 (Wednesday) at 3.00 PM
body:
Gentle Reminder
> for tomorrow's  *User Awareness Workshop *on *Sage*
<https://drive.google.com/file/d/1rPW6nMIbXWkmekHZb2kuQtq3ssxLRiI1/view?usp=drive_link>

---------- Forwarded message ---------

Subject: KRC: Invitation to USER AWARENESS WORKSHOP on Sage resources at
KRC-Ground Floor-AVRoom-1 on 03-09-2025 (Wednesday) at 3.00 PM

*G**reetings from IITH-KRC (Library)!!!*

*D**ear All,*

IITH-KRC (Library) is happy to announce and cordially invite you to attend
the below *User Awareness Workshop.*

Please find the attachment for more details and Registration link.

*IITH-KRC *in collaboration with *Sage**,* invites you to an


      *User Awareness Workshop *on *Sage*
<https://drive.google.com/file/d/1rPW6nMIbXWkmekHZb2kuQtq3ssxLRiI1/view?usp=drive_link>
 resources

Venue:            *KRC Ground Floor - AV Room-1*

Date:              03-09-2025 (Wednesday)

Time:             3.00 PM to 4.00 PM :  Sage Journals

Audiences:     All faculty members, Research Scholars, and PG students

**Project Muse & AAAS-Science - This session-1 is cancelled due to the
medical emergency of the speaker. Future date will be intimated later.*

*Registration: *

Please confirm your participation by registering *on or before 03-09-2025*
at Registration link: <https://forms.gle/cG8PcV5z5hHTCd9K>*Click here*
<https://forms.gle/cG8PcV5z5hHTCd9K6>

*All faculty, research scholars and students are cordially invited to
attend this event*

subject: Re: Invitation to National Space Day â€“ 02 Sept. 2025
body:
Hi all,
   This is a gentle reminder for National Space Day Celebration today.

Venue: LHC-5

Regards
Manish


On Thu, Aug 28, 2025, 12:10 Hod Physics <head@phy.iith.ac.in> wrote:

> Dear All,
>
> We are pleased to inform you that a one-day program will be organized to
> celebrate National Space Day on 02 September 2025, as declared by our
> Honâ€™ble Prime Minister, to commemorate the historic Chandrayaan-3 Moon
> landingâ€”a remarkable achievement of Indian space scientists.
>
> We are honored to have Dr. V. Seshagiri Rao, Former Associate Director of
> ISRO and Project Director of the Multi-Object Tracking Radar (MOTR), as our
> Chief Guest. The National Remote Sensing Centre (NRSC), ISRO, has kindly
> agreed to collaborate with us by developing and showcasing exhibits on this
> occasion. Around 120 school participants are expected to attend the event.
>
> On behalf of the organizing team, we extend a cordial invitation to you to
> grace the inaugural ceremony as per the following details:
> Inauguration (LHC-05, Galileo, Lecture Hall Complex)
> Inauguration Ceremony: 11 AM
> Opening messages by the Director: 11:10-11:15 AM
> Remarks by the guest of honour: 11:15-11:25 AM
> Keynote talk by the Chief Guest and felicitations of guests: 11:25-12:10 AM
> Award presentation by the Chief Guest for different competition winners:
> 12:10-12:20 PM
> Address and closing remarks by the HoD, Department of Physics: 12:20-12:30
> PM
>
> Exhibitions and competitions (LHC ground floor lobby and LHC-02)
> 10:00-11:00 and 2:00-3:45 PM: Model and painting exhibitions by students
> 2:00-3:45 PM: impromptu competition (LHC-02)
> Prize distribution for winners: (3:45-4:00 PM)
>
> We look forward to your presence and your interaction with students during
> the model displays, painting exhibitions, and impromptu competitions
> planned for the day. Your participation will certainly inspire the
> students and add immense value to this celebration of Indiaâ€™s remarkable
> space achievements.
>
> Best Regards
> Manish
>
>
> *...........................................................................*

subject: Fwd: Selection Trials for Inter IIT Team probables
body:
Dear Students,

FYI


---------- Forwarded message ---------
From: Mathew M Philip <ee22btech11211@iith.ac.in>
Date: Tue, 2 Sept, 2025, 11:10
Subject: Selection Trials for Inter IIT Team probables
To: Kowsith Gurubilli <sports_secy@gymkhana.iith.ac.in>


Dear Students,

We are excited to announce the trials for probables of forming the Menâ€™s &
Women's Basketball team for the upcoming Inter IIT Sports Meet scheduled to
be held in the month of December at IIT Madras. The trials will be
conducted under the guidance of our Coach Ms Ruchi Yadav and are open to
all students.

 *Details of the Trials:*

 *Date:* 03.09.2025

*Time:* 7:00 pm to 8:30 pm

*Venue:* SNCC Basketball Court

*Dress Code*: Shorts & T-shirt

*Sportswear* with *non-marking shoes* (Mandatory)



The selected players will constitute the official Institute Basketball
Team, which will represent our institute at the Inter IIT Sports Meet as
well as in practice matches and other tournaments throughout the year. The
team will also have daily training sessions to prepare for the upcoming
tournaments.

We encourage all interested students to participate to showcase their
talent. This is a great opportunity to play competitive basketball and
represent our institute. We sincerely invite you all on behalf of our coach
and the old team members, and we look forward to your participation.

Please note that the SNCC Basketball Court will be *reserved for Inter IIT
team practice* from today (02.09.2025) until December, from *6:30 PM to
9:00 PM daily.*



*For any queries, contact:*

Mathew â€“ 8089040111

Anjali â€“ 9406815374



Best regards,

Mathew M Philip
Coordinator,Basketball IITH
Thanks & Regards / à¤¸à¤¾à¤¦à¤° à¤§à¤¨à¥à¤¯à¤µà¤¾à¤¦

subject: Re: [Internship] Media.net | Senior Product Analyst Intern â€“ Registration
body:
Dear All,
Due to multiple requests, the deadline has been extended until 4 pm today.
Please note that no further extensions would be given.
The schedule regarding the Online Assesment would be conveyed in due
course of time.

Best Regards
Sarvesh Goyal

On Sun, 31 Aug 2025, 21:54 Sarvesh Goyal, <ic23btech11019@iith.ac.in> wrote:

> Dear All,
> Hope you are doing well.
>
> We are pleased to inform you that* Media.net *is visiting IIT Hyderabad
> again and inviting applications for the role of *Senior Product
> Analyst Intern* as part of the ongoing internship drive. Do make best use
> of the opportunity.
> Further details are available on the *OCS portal.*
>
> *Deadline* *to register: 11:59 PM, September 1st, 2025*
>
> Interested and eligible students must register on the OCS portal before
> the deadline. *All the further information will be made and conveyed
> through this email thread only.*
>
> Warm Regards,
>
> *Sarvesh Goyal*
> Internship Coordinator, OCS
> Indian Institute of Technology Hyderabad
> Phone: +91-92852-83563
>
>

--

subject: Re: Internship Opportunity â€“ BNY Mellon
body:
Prior registration before 5:30 pm today will be considered and will receive
the test link

Thanks

On Mon, 1 Sep 2025 at 4:47â€¯PM, Manav Rathi <ic23btech11013@iith.ac.in>
wrote:

> Dear Students,
>
> Please find below the details for the upcoming BNY Online Assessment.
> Kindly go through all the instructions carefully and complete prior
> registration.
>
> Test Details:
>
>
>    -
>
>    Date: 2nd September 2025
>    -
>
>    Test Login Window: 6:30 PM to 6:50 PM IST (You must log in within this
>    window to appear for the test)
>    -
>
>    Test Duration: 2 Hours 30 Minutes
>    -
>
>    Prior Registration Link (Mandatory â€“ apply latest by 1st Sept 2025):
>
>    https://eofe.fa.us2.oraclecloud.com/hcmUI/CandidateExperience/en/sites/CX_1001/job/67344/?utm_medium=jobshare&utm_source=External+Job+Share
>
>    -
>
>    Test Link: https://hr.gs/bnytest2
>    -
>
>    Password: bny2025 (use this while logging into the test, not your
>    Windows password)
>
>
> Important Instructions:
>
>
>    1.
>
>    The test link will be active only during your allotted login window.
>    2.
>
>    Do not attempt to login/start before the allotted time â€“ it will lead
>    to disqualification.
>    3.
>
>    Webcam must remain ON throughout the test.
>    4.
>
>    Read all test instructions carefully before starting.
>    5.
>
>    Keep a resume (soft copy) ready for upload before the test.
>    6.
>
>    Keep Aadhar Card and PAN Card (hard or soft copy) handy.
>    7.
>
>    Test will be monitored by a physical proctor/invigilator from the
>    Placement Team
>
>    Wishing you all the very best for the assessment!
>
>    Regards,
>
>    Manav Rathi
>
>    Internship Coordinator
>
>
>
> On Tue, 26 Aug 2025 at 10:10â€¯PM, Manav Rathi <ic23btech11013@iith.ac.in>
> wrote:
>
>> Hey all ,
>>
>> Final reminder to Register before the deadline
>>
>> Regards
>> Manav Rathi
>>
>> On Tue, 26 Aug 2025 at 10:26â€¯AM, Manav Rathi <ic23btech11013@iith.ac.in>
>> wrote:
>>
>>> Hey all ,
>>>
>>> This is a gentle reminder to register on OCS portal before the deadline .
>>>
>>> Regards
>>> Manav Rathi
>>>
>>>
>>> On Sat, 23 Aug 2025 at 3:14â€¯PM, Manav Rathi <ic23btech11013@iith.ac.in>
>>> wrote:
>>>
>>>> Dear Batchmates,
>>>>
>>>> I am pleased to inform you that *BNY Mellon* will be visiting our
>>>> campus as part of the OCS Internship Drive for the role of *Software
>>>> Development Intern*.
>>>>
>>>> Interested and eligible students are requested to register on the OCS
>>>> portal before the deadline: *26th August, 11:59 PM*.
>>>>
>>>> For any queries, feel free to reach out to me.
>>>>
>>>> Best regards,
>>>> *Manav Rathi*
>>>> Internship Coordinator
>>>> Office of Career Services
>>>> 7878342142
>>>>
>>>

body:
Dear Students,

We are pleased to announce the results of the recently conducted PG Class
Representative elections for the academic year *2025â€“26*.
Department Representatives
Additive manufacturing KOILADA BINDU MADHAVA
Artificial Intelligence Sneh Sourabh
Bio Medical Engineering Joel Mathew James
Bio Technology Devak Shah
Chemical Engineering Prajwal
Civil Engineering Vemula Pranay
Climate Change Peela Bala Anthony Kushal
Computer Science and Engineering Divyansh Sevta  (NIS)
Computer Science and Engineering Jay Pokale
Design Srijita Ghosh (Visual Design)
Electrical Engineering Dorsela Keerthi Chandrika (Communication and Signal
Processing Learning)
Electrical Engineering Abdul Aleem Ahmed Sabihuddin (PowerElectronics and
Power Systems)
Electrical Engineering Joel Giby(Microelectronics and VLSI)
Entrepreneurship and Management Samhita M Kiran (Techno Entrepreneurship)
Greenko School of Sustainability Krishna Gaur(Sustainable engineering )
Greenko School of Sustainability Manikanteswar reddy (E-waste Resource
Engineering Management)
Greenko School of Sustainability Anshu Rajput (E-waste Resource Engineering
Management )
Integrated Circuits and Microsystem Packaging Mohammad Abdul Aleem Hazari
Lightweight Engineering Kartikeya Arpan Desai
Materials Science and Metallurgical Engineering Malothu Chandrashekar
Mathematics Gunmay Singla
Mechanical & Aerospace Engineering SOUMYA RANJAN SUTAR (Integrated Design
and Manufacturing)
Mechanical & Aerospace Engineering Vikram Kumar Anand (Robotics and
intelligence system)
Mechanical & Aerospace Engineering Sanjai V (Aerospace Engineering)
Medical Device Innovation Kailash Sathya Narayanan
MSc Physics Shivanshu Pandey
Opthalmic Engineering Mohana Krishnan H
Physics Manpreet Singh Monga (Quantum and Solid State Devices)
Smart Mobility Manish More

We would like to congratulate all the elected CRs and wish them the very
best for their tenure. The role of a CR is crucial in bridging
communication between students and the institute, and we are confident that
the newly elected representatives will take forward the responsibilities
with sincerity and dedication.

*All shortlisted students are requested to kindly reply to this same mail
thread with their WhatsApp contact details for further communication.*

On behalf of the student body, We also thank everyone who participated in
the election process and contributed to making it smooth and fair.

Looking forward to working together for the betterment of our PG community.
*______________________________*
*Thanks and Regards,*
*KIRITHIKA K S & V V S R SAI SASHANK*
*Postgraduate Representatives*
*Students Gymkhana 2025-2026*

--

subject: Your HackerRank FY26 | Cisco Day - Online Assessment | Summer Internship | 03 Sep 2025 Invitation
body:
FY26 | Cisco Day - Online Assessment | Summer Internship | 03 Sep 2025 - powered by HackerRank



  
    
      
        
        
          
    Hi,
    
    Thank you for your interest in joining Cisco Systems Inc! We're excited to invite you to the next step in the process: the HackerRank FY26 | Cisco Day - Online Assessment | Summer Internship | 03 Sep 2025 assessment. This is a great opportunity to showcase your skills, and we're here to support you along the way.
    Here's what you need to know:
    
        Timeline: Please complete the assessment within 7 calendar days, or as discussed with your recruiter.
        Practice Makes Perfect: To help you feel confident, we've included a sample test where you can explore the HackerRank environment and practice before starting the official test.
    
    A few tips for success:
    
        Create the Right Environment: Set up in a quiet, private space where you can focus.
        Understand Each Question: Take a moment to carefully read each question before diving in.
        Avoid Disruptions: Once you start, complete the test in one uninterrupted session. Avoid refreshing your browser or using the back button to prevent losing progress.
    
    Feel free to reach out to your recruiter if you have any questions.
    Wishing you the best of luck with the assessmentâ€”go show us your skills!
    
    Happy coding,
    The Cisco Systems Inc Hiring Team
  
        
        
      

      

      
        
          
            
              Recommended Browser: Google Chrome v101 or greater
            
          
          
          
             
              Duration: 90 min 
            
            
          
          
          
          Start Login Date/Time:
          
            3 Sep 2025 08:00 PM IST
            
            (Asia - Kolkata)
            
          
          
          
          
          End Login Date/Time: 3 Sep 2025 08:35 PM IST
            
            (Asia - Kolkata)
            
          
          
          
            Start Test
          
          You can also use this
          test link
          to access the test
          
          anytime before the test expiry date above.
          Please check date and time in your time zone.
          
          
        
      
    
  


Please note once you begin the test the timer will start and the test cannot be paused. Hence it is highly recommended that you complete the test in one sitting.

In case of power failure or loss of internet connection, the test timer will continue to run even though you might not be attempting it, in such a case please contact us by replying back to this email.

For any technical queries, please refer to https://track.pstmrk.it/3ts/candidatesupport.hackerrank.com%2Fhc%2Fen-us%2Fcategories%2F4402828710675-FAQ/EDcI/67_-AQ/AQ/c50f5f80-e51d-4161-b764-6c3b9e0073be/5/Pd8INbm8r6 or contact us at https://track.pstmrk.it/3ts/customersupport.hackerrank.com%2Fhc%2Fen-us%2Frequests%2Fnew%3Fticket_form_id%3D360001035834./EDcI/67_-AQ/AQ/c50f5f80-e51d-4161-b764-6c3b9e0073be/7/ygQ1IwAy1V

HackerRank only provides a platform to conduct the tests. It does not schedule or evaluate any hiring tests or conduct interviews for any company. Hence for any of the above requests please contact the company that sent you the invite.

Re: Internship Opportunity â€“ BNY Mellon
body:
Dear Students,

Please find below the details for the upcoming BNY Online Assessment.
Kindly go through all the instructions carefully and complete prior
registration.

Test Details:


   -

   Date: 2nd September 2025
   -

   Test Login Window: 6:30 PM to 6:50 PM IST (You must log in within this
   window to appear for the test)
   -

   Test Duration: 2 Hours 30 Minutes
   -

   Prior Registration Link (Mandatory â€“ apply latest by 1st Sept 2025):

   https://eofe.fa.us2.oraclecloud.com/hcmUI/CandidateExperience/en/sites/CX_1001/job/67344/?utm_medium=jobshare&utm_source=External+Job+Share
   -

   Test Link: https://hr.gs/bnytest2
   -

   Password: bny2025 (use this while logging into the test, not your
   Windows password)


Important Instructions:


   1.

   The test link will be active only during your allotted login window.
   2.

   Do not attempt to login/start before the allotted time â€“ it will lead to
   disqualification.
   3.

   Webcam must remain ON throughout the test.
   4.

   Read all test instructions carefully before starting.
   5.

   Keep a resume (soft copy) ready for upload before the test.
   6.

   Keep Aadhar Card and PAN Card (hard or soft copy) handy.
   7.

   Test will be monitored by a physical proctor/invigilator from the
   Placement Team

   Wishing you all the very best for the assessment!

   Regards,

   Manav Rathi

   Internship Coordinator

subject: Final Shortlist for ATF
body:
Greetings from AlgoUniversity!

We are pleased to share with you the list of students from your institute
who have met the attendance criteria for the ATF 2025 Induction Session.
All these students are now shortlisted for *Stage 1 of the ATF Coding Test*,
scheduled on *September 21, 2025 and September 22, 2025**.* Exact slots
will be communicated shortly.

------------------------------

*ATF Stage 1 Coding Test â€“ Overview*

   -

   Duration: 90 minutes

   -

   Sections & Marks:

   -

      Mathematical Aptitude & Reasoning â€“ 80 marks

      -

      Data Structures & Algorithms â€“ 120 marks

      -

   Proctoring: AI-based video + audio, strict monitoring


------------------------------

*Rules & Instructions*

   -

   Languages Allowed: C, C++, Java, Python

   -

   Scoring: No partial scoring â€” only fully correct solutions will be
   awarded marks

   -

   Exam Integrity: Strict plagiarism checks in place; tab switching,
   external compilers, AI tools, or peer assistance are strictly prohibited

   -

   Proctoring Requirements: Test is AI-proctored â€” students must keep camera
   and microphone on throughout

   -

   Device: Laptop/desktop with stable internet; mobile devices not permitted

   -

   Disqualification: Any malpractice will lead to immediate disqualification


------------------------------

*Additional Notes*

   -

   These instructions are aligned with the coding test practices of leading
   tech companies (Google, Amazon, Microsoft, Oracle, etc.)

   -

   Students are advised to log in 15 minutes early for system checks.


------------------------------

For any clarifications, feel free to reach out to our team at
support@algouniversity.zohodesk.in or chat with us *HERE
<https://algouniversity.zohodesk.in/portal/en/home>*

Thanks & Regards,

Arin Aggarwal
Career Cell Manager
Office of Career Services, IIT Hyderabad
Cell~ +91 7087850215

--

of theÂ users of IITH. So, do not mark it as SPAM.

subject: Invitation for Ganesh Nimarjan â€“ 1st September 2025
body:
Dear Students,

We are glad to inform you that the *Nimarjan of Lord Ganesha* will be held
on 1st September 2025. As part of the celebrations, we will have the *last
Aarthi* tomorrow evening, followed by the Nimarjan at *4:30 PM.*

We warmly invite everyone to join us for the pooja and take part in the
festivities, devotion, and joy of this occasion. Let us come together as
one community to bid farewell to Lord Ganesha with prayers and celebration.

Details:
ğŸ“… Date: 1st September 2025

All are welcome!
